opportunities.description:
Help keep Sutro Heights and the San Francisco shoreline beautiful! Volunteers are needed to help keep these popular public destinations well maintained for both local and worldwide visitors to use and enjoy. Projects include litter and sand removal, weeding invasive plants, vegetation pruning, painting, site improvements, and trail maintenance.

Volunteer programs take place on Wednesdays, 9 am-noon.

Visit our website to register and learn more about this program: http://www.parksconservancy.org/get-involved/volunteer/drop-in-programs/goga-maintenance-sutro.html

Volunteers must complete the Volunteer Agreement Form and volunteers under the age of 18 must have the parent/guardian approval section signed.

Wear clothes that can get dirty. Long pants and closed-toe shoes are required. Bring layers for changing weather and rain gear if necessary. Bring a personal water bottle and sunscreen.

Visit our Volunteer Homepage for more details about individual, group, family-friendly, or long-term volunteer opportunities: www.parksconservancy.org/volunteer

The Golden Gate National Parks Volunteer Program is a cooperative parkwide effort of the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy, the National Park Service, and the Presidio Trust.

Assistant Hospitality Monitors provide a welcoming presence for homeless guests in the sanctuary of St. John's church as they sleep or rest or seek help. They, with the Hospitality Monitor staff, help set the tone, give out food and emergency and essential supplies, and clean the space as needed.

Shifts are two to two and a half hours. Current availabilty is:

Wed - 6-8 am

opportunities.description:
Sort/clean/corrdinate our Client Store.

We receive many donations for our women and they are allowed to 'shop' each Friday afternoon. Currenlty the store is in need of sorting/cleaning/removing of items to have the store operational.

Each Friday the clients are given the opportunity to shop and a 'manager' needs to be onsite to open the store and then close up. This occurs each Friday afternoon at 3:30. Before and after the 'shopping' time, items can be sorted for relevence and non-relevent items are bagged for removal to other agencies. The sorting and cleaning may be done any time between 9-5 Monday through Friday with the store open for shopping on Firday afternoons. One volunteer could be the store manager on Friday for 2 hours and another volunteer could be sorting and arranging during the week. OR one person could work longer on Friday to organize and sell.

We would love to have a commitment that is ongoing.

Thank you for your interest.

Help keep the shoreline of San Francisco beautiful! Volunteers are needed to help with vegetation management and site improvements along the coast of San Francisco in the Golden Gate National Parks. Sites include Fort Mason, Presidio of San Francisco, China Beach, Lands End, Ocean Beach, Sutro Heights Park and Fort Funston. Projects include litter and sand removal, weeding invasive plants, vegetation pruning, painting, site improvements, and trail maintenance.

Volunteer programs take place on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays, 9 am-noon.

Visit our website to register and learn more about this program: http://www.parksconservancy.org/get-involved/volunteer/drop-in-programs/golden-gate-maintenance.html

Volunteers must complete the Volunteer Agreement Form and volunteers under the age of 18 must have the parent/guardian approval section signed.

Wear clothes that can get dirty. Long pants and closed-toe shoes are required. Bring layers for changing weather and rain gear if necessary. Bring a personal water bottle and sunscreen.

Visit our Volunteer Homepage for more details about individual, group, family-friendly, or long-term volunteer opportunities: www.parksconservancy.org/volunteer

The Golden Gate National Parks Volunteer Program is a cooperative parkwide effort of the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy, theNational Park Service, and the Presidio Trust.

opportunities.description:
Rare genomics Institute

RG is an international non-profit that provides access to cutting edge research technologies, physicians, and scientists across the globe. By providing an expert network and an online crowdfunding mechanism, RG helps families pursue personalized research projects for diseases not otherwise studied. We bring together scientists who share our passion for helping rare disease patients and leverage the crowdfunding capabilities of the Internet to bring the hope of a cure to our patients.

We are looking for an experienced developer with a passion for frontend work. You have built complex web apps using AngularJS or another modern Javascript framework. You create structured, modular CSS. You play nicely with designers and care about implementing pixel-perfect, responsive, jank-free interfaces

Requirements

  • You have a demonstrable track record of building highly interactive Web/Mobile applications.

  • You write elegant, reusable, well tested code and can strike the right balance between writing perfect code and shipping it rapidly and iteratively.

  • You are able to design and implement large projects in a self-directed fashion.

  • You quickly assimilate whatever technologies are needed for a project.

  • When pointed at a target, you eliminate obstacles and just make it happen - usually in a way that is more awesome than originally envisioned.

Hybrid Mobile development

  • iOS, Android, hybrid (PhoneGap/Cordova), Ionic framework

Helpful experience

Phonegap, Ionic framework, HTML5 apps using Cordova, CSS, Ruby on Rails, Sass, Angular.js, Node

Rare genomics Mobile App Team:

We are building a great Patient centric mobile App for Rare Genetic conditions, composed by patient-centric features such Medication logs, Mood and Symptoms trackers, Social network and Donors engagement Platform using gamification tools.

If you are highly committed to our Rare Genomics cause join us!. We welcome people who recognize the importance of collaboration to turn great ideas into great products.

opportunities.description:
WOMEN IN COMEDY

SEEKING VOLUNTEERS TO JOIN THE COMMITTEE OF THE BRAND NEW SF CHAPTER

WELCOME

Welcome and thank you for your interest in donating your time as a volunteer executive comitttee member of the SF chapter to further Women In Comedy. Your time is so valuable to us and we appreciate you!

MISSION STATEMENT

So, what are we here to do? It is very important to us that you understand our Mission Statement to understand what we are here to accomplish:

"We believe in educating, empowering, and connecting powerful, ambitious, hilarious, and talented women in the comedy industry with resources that foster their professional development and advancement. Through our online and real-life community, we promote the creation of personal relationships, business relationships, and mentoring relationships in order to advance and increase women's voices, presence, and pay scale in the comedy industry."

Role: VP of SF Chapter for Women in Comedy

Description:

Currently, we are seeking well-connected, organized, and reliable volunteers to help our brand new SF Chapter. As the chapter grows you will help grow its network and facilitate live events in tandem with our Chicago hub. This role will transition into chapter president after one year. To ease the transition, for the entire year the current chapter president will mentor you and groom you for the role.

Duties may include but are not limited to:

  1. Help execute 3 successful events in tandem with headquarters utilizing all Women In Comedy documents, timelines, and assignments.

  2. Help Maintain a committee of 3 other diverse women to help with the execution of all events.

  3. Oversee, manage, and execute duties assigned by the Chapter President.

Our volunteer base is building and expanding. We are excited to be in the launching phase of the organization and this will afford opportunities for dedicated volunteers to become volunteer department heads in the near future as the organization evolves and we identify the top areas of need in our community. For now, we are asking volunteer event coordinators to help us replicate and facilitate events in various cities. Our opportunities allow our volunteers to help remotely as well if they cannot physically be present.

STEP ONE: Please email us at SF@womenincomedy.org OR respond to this posting
STEP TWO: Fill out our volunteer form: http://goo.gl/forms/mCLvC6NXNe

opportunities.description:
UniversalGiving is seeking an Operations Intern/Volunteer to support day-to-day activities for the organization. This position offers broad experience and exposure to diverse areas of how a nonprofit functions. If you are a well-rounded person with many different talents and skills, we want to hear from you today.

Full Description

UniversalGiving™, an award-winning global social-entrepreneurship nonprofit organization, is seeking an Operations Intern to support day-to-day activities for the organization. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, diverse support to staff management, business-operations planning support, assistance with volunteer recruitment and team member setup, basic administrative assistance, general office maintenance, and light technical support. This position offers wide exposure in working with multiple business units within the organization, including NGO Services, CSR, Technology Systems, People Management, and Office Administration. We require a well-rounded, multi-talented individual who has a passion for details with a strong ability to execute their work consistently in a professional manner. Ideally, this person thrives in a goal-based, deadline-driven, fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

UniversalGiving™ internships offer exciting opportunities to those wishing to make a significant impact and contribution to our global communities. Join UniversalGiving and work closely with a dedicated international team, while gaining valuable skills in a social-entrepreneurship nonprofit organization.

Testimonial
"Working with UniversalGiving has given me the chance to participate in critical aspects of business management and partnership facilitation, which are opportunities that would definitely be off-limits to "the intern" at most corporations. The friendly and ultra-supportive executive team here wants their interns to contribute to the main goals and aspirations of UniversalGiving in important ways and helps them to do so, which is what makes working here so rewarding and fun - so fun, in fact, that I will continue to be a part of their team even after leaving the San Francisco office!" --- Emily Stehr, UG Representative at Princeton University, Summer Intern

About UniversalGiving
UniversalGiving™ is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model™ to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled on CBS and in FOX Business Network, and has also been featured in BusinessWeekFast Company, CSRWire, WomenEntrepreneur, Oprah.com, NBC News, The Christian Science Monitor, The New York Times, The Financial Times, MarketWatch, CNNMoney.com, Change.org and See Change Magazine. UniversalGiving™ is the 2010 winner of the Opportunity Knocks' Best Nonprofit to Work for Award.

CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is also a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute. She has been chosen as a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR.

Duration: Minimum 15-20 hours per week, ideal candidate is available Tuesday through Friday 9am-5pm for the duration of the internship (3-4 mo internship). Ideal candidates are available to work in our downtown San Francisco office.

Qualifications:

  • Strong computer skills, including basic knowledge of technology systems, proficiency with internet-based research, and intermediate-level experience with Microsoft Word and Excel
  • Strong basic working knowledge of in-office technologies (printer, copier, fax, etc)
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Preference for working in a fast paced environment
  • Works well with deadlines and multiple assignments
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Responsive to manager feedback, ability to take direction and execute work independently with minimal oversight
  • Interest in nonprofit work, international issues, and philanthropy
  • Full support of the mission and vision of UniversalGiving™

Benefits:

  • Experience working at a unique global, social-entrepreneurship nonprofit
  • Collaboration within a positive team environment
  • Increased understanding of and alignment with global issues
  • Networking with other nonprofit professionals
  • Career mentoring with Pamela Hawley, Founder & CEO of UniversalGiving™
  • For students, class credit can be arranged according to school requirements

To Apply:

Email your resume, cover letter, and writing sample to volunteers@universalgiving.org with "Operations Intern/Volunteer" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please.

UniversalGiving™ is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations.

UniversalGiving’s vision is to “Create a World Where Giving and Volunteering Are a Natural Part of Everyday Life.”™

For more information please visit:

  • UniversalGiving’s website
  • UniversalGiving’s Blog: PhilanthroPost
  • CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog: Living and Giving
  • Follow Us on Twitter: @UniversalGiving and @PamelaHawley
  • Like us on Facebook

opportunities.description:
Academy volunteer divers plunge into stunningly beautiful environments while feeding fish and keeping tanks sparkling clean. Interested divers may also be trained to deliver dive presentations in our Philippine Coral Reef tank, one of the deepest live-coral aquarium exhibits in the world.

Volunteer diver requirements:

  • Minimum of 50 logged SCUBA Dives
  • Current CPR, First Aid, and Oxygen Provider certifications
  • Pass the Academy diver medical exam (conducted by your physician)
  • Pass the Academy swimming and SCUBA diving skill pool evaluation
  • Commitment of 2 dives shifts per month

opportunities.description:
RRRcomputer.org's vision is "1 Child, 1 Computer" to become a reality. Our mission is to reclaim, refurbish, reuse computers from recycling to reuse for education for low income K-12 kids. We reduce computer waste by refurbishing the computers to put back into circulation for the kids to use for internet search for research, and doing their homework assignment at home. The computers that are going to recycling is still useful for their needs. We do our part in saving the planet and improve the education of children.

We are looking for Graphic Designers who will be able to help us out with designs and colaterials that we need. Your assistant is greatly appreciated.

Regards,

Hue

opportunities.description:
We are in need of volunteers with leadership qualities, a desire to change the world and a passionate dislike of cancer.

This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

The Event Leadership Team is divided into 3 areas: People, Experience and Fund the Cure.

Strengths or Areas of Interest:

People Team: Get people to the event and help them be awesome!
- Enjoy meeting new people
- Enjoy talking with and getting to know new people
- Enjoy mentoring, teaching, and/or coaching
- Interested in making a significant impact in people’s lives
- Relationship Oriented
- Passionate about cancer survivors & caregivers
Helpful:
- Background/interest in Sales/Recruitment

Experience Team: Make the event FUN!
- Enjoy logistics and/or planning
- Enjoy being creative!
- Like planning and running activities, games and entertainment
- Like making people smile and feel appreciated
Helpful:
- Background/interest in Marketing/Promotion
- Experience planning events of any kind

Fund the Cure Team: Make a bigger impact on the fight against cancer!
- Enjoy making an impact in the dollars helping fund research and services
- Enjoy fundraising and aren’t afraid to ask for donations
- Passionate about making cancer education fun!
- Passionate about growing the number of lives saved from cancer
Helpful:
- Business oriented
- Background/interest in Sales/Recruitment

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: People Lead

The role of the People Lead is simply put, to bring the people. This critical role serves as the recruitment and engagement expert of the Event Leadership Team.

Individuals in this role lead the recruitment and engagement of Relay For Life teams and participants, survivors and caregivers, as well as the Relay For Life Event Leadership Team members. Individuals in this role possess strong leadership and mentoring skills. They are comfortable developing and cultivating relationships within the community while representing the American Cancer Society and the Relay For Life event.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

* Work with the Relay For Life Community Manager to ensure that training of role and resources takes place.

* Assist Event Lead and Relay For Life Community Manager in recruiting Event Leadership Team members.

* Assist and mentor Community Champions and the Survivors and Caregivers Lead.

* Provide guidance and support in recruitment of event participants and volunteers.

* Regularly communicate with Team Ambassadors regarding event-specific information.

* Work with the Event Leader and Relay For Life Community Manager to create and execute development strategies to grow the participation and quality of the event with utilization of benchmarking strategies.

* Making the ask of individuals, organizations, and local leaders to get involved with the Relay For Life event.

* Discuss fundraising goals with the Event Leader, Fund the Cure Leader, and Relay For Life Community Manager to ensure that recruitment is helping achieve those goals.

* Review recruitment benchmarks on a monthly or bi-monthly basis with the Event Leader and Relay For Life Community Manager to ensure goals are being met.

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!

opportunities.description: We are seeking volunteers of all levels and from all walks of life to help us deliver these vital and free services to the community. Tax sites are located all over the Bay Area. For a full list of our locations please visit: http://www.tax-aid.org/need-tax-help/ There are volunteer opportunities for Greeters, Interviewers/ Tax Preparers, Translators, Check-out Assemblers, Tax Return Reviewers and Tax Experts. While some opportunities require knowledge of tax laws and require certification, there are many volunteer opportunities for those who are not tax experts. Tax-Aid Volunteer Responsibilities for All Positions Commit to a minimum of four volunteer session (an average session last about 5 hours) during the tax season Complete online training classes Work with individuals in a positive, patient and respectful manner Preferred Skills, Experience, Attitude and Availability Bilingual skills desirable (English/Spanish, English/Cantonese or English/Mandarin) Strong interpersonal communication skills Tax background desirable, but not required Experience working with people with low income desirable Enthusiastic and flexible Availability Saturdays Specific Positions Greeters Greet Taxpayers Make sure they are comfortable while they wait Check that they have the necessary documents so they can be helped Interviewer / Tax Preparers Familiar with Lacerte’s tax preparation software Must have tax background or be a tax professional Interview Taxpayers Complete tax forms Prepare the return for filing Translators Must be bilingual or multilingual Must be able to conduct communication between the Taxpayer and Tax Preparer Help to interview Taxpayer Desired language skills are English/Spanish, English/Cantonese or English/Mandarin both verbal and written Printer Prints client tax returns Must have working knowledge of HP printers and troubleshooting skills Basic background of the Lacerte’s tax program required Checkout / Assembler Assembles the client return Explains e-filing/mailing procedure to Taxpayer Obtain signatures to complete paperwork for return/e-filing Tax Return Reviewers Review returns that have already been prepared Must have tax background or be a tax professional Tax Expert On site to answer any complex tax questions How to Apply: Register online at http://www.tax-aid.org/tax-volunteers/ For questions or more information email: admin@tax-aid.org

opportunities.description:
Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations?

Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more.

Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers.

We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.

opportunities.description:
The PAWS Pet Food Bank is the very first service provided by the PAWS program of Shanti and has been in operation since 1987.

The Food Bank provides PAWS clients with a supplemental allotment of pet food, litter and a variety of pet supplies (e.g., toys, treats, collars, leashes, carriers/crates, etc.) every month. This basic but essential service can often mean the difference between our clients meeting their own nutritional needs and sacrificing their needs to feed their animal companions, or being able to keep their pets in their lives at all.

Many of our clients are unable to come to the Pet Food Bank, located at the PAWS office, due to their disability. We rely on the generosity and commitment of volunteers to deliver food and supplies to all of our homebound clients.

Can you spare 3 hours on a Saturday morning to help keep these critter companions fed?

WHO & WHAT:

Food Bank Driver

Nature of the Position

  • Working with a volunteer Rider, deliver bags of pet food to 8-10 clients
  • Rider reads map and navigates driver to clients’ homes.
  • If a volunteer would like to be paired with a friend, spouse, partner, family member, etc., he/she can notify PAWS Staff.

Requirements:

  • Minimum age of 18
  • Must have your own vehicle, current driver’s license, and proof of insurance. Vehicle must have sufficient space for one passenger and up to 20 grocery bags of pet food and supplies.
  • Able to lift up to 15 lbs. to assist with loading vehicle
  • Comfortable driving to any/all neighborhoods in SF

Food Bank Rider

Nature of the Position:

  • Working with a volunteer Driver to deliver bags of pet food and supplies to 8-10 clients throughout SF
  • Rider is responsible for navigation (with map & directions provided) and carrying food and supplies into clients’ homes

Requirements:

  • Must be at least 18 years old, or 13 years or older when accompanied by parent or guardian
  • Complete an orientation
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 40 lbs
  • Must be able to walk up and down stairs and/or use elevators
  • Comfortable going into clients’ homes in various neighborhoods and types of housing/buildings/residences
  • Comfortable engaging with clients and, possibly, their pets

WHEN: Saturdays 10AM - 1PM. Volunteers can elect to be on on-call status or commit to one Saturday per month.

WHERE: Starting at the PAWS office in the Mission District and going to clients’ homes in various neighborhoods in SF.

HOW: For more information or to apply, please contact Volunteer Services at volunteerservices@shanti.org.

Other ways to support the PAWS Pet Food Bank?

Donate much needed items* including: dry & canned cat food (especially Fancy Feast), dry & canned dog food (especially Cesar’s), treats (especially cat treats), poop bags, clumping cat litter, leashes, toys and clothing (especially for small dogs.)

*We accept food in its original packaging that has not passed its expiration or 'Best by’ date, and new or clean, gently used clothing and supplies.
opportunities.tags: san francisco, delivery, LGBT, seniors, pets, animal care, Queer, food bank, Pet care, car, Community, mental health
opportunities.title: Pet Food Bank Delivery Volunteers Needed!
opportunities.plaintextDescription: The PAWS Pet Food Bank is the very first service provided by the PAWS program of Shanti and has been in operation since 1987. The Food Bank provides PAWS clients with a supplemental allotment of pet food, litter and a variety of pet supplies (e.g., toys, treats, collars, leashes, carriers/crates, etc.) every month. This basic but essential service can often mean the difference between our clients meeting their own nutritional needs and sacrificing their needs to feed their animal companions, or being able to keep their pets in their lives at all. Many of our clients are unable to come to the Pet Food Bank, located at the PAWS office, due to their disability. We rely on the generosity and commitment of volunteers to deliver food and supplies to all of our homebound clients. Can you spare 3 hours on a Saturday morning to help keep these critter companions fed? WHO & WHAT: Food Bank Driver Nature of the Position Working with a volunteer Rider, deliver bags of pet food to 8-10 clients Rider reads map and navigates driver to clients’ homes. If a volunteer would like to be paired with a friend, spouse, partner, family member, etc., he/she can notify PAWS Staff. Requirements: Minimum age of 18 Must have your own vehicle, current driver’s license, and proof of insurance. Vehicle must have sufficient space for one passenger and up to 20 grocery bags of pet food and supplies. Able to lift up to 15 lbs. to assist with loading vehicle Comfortable driving to any/all neighborhoods in SF Food Bank Rider Nature of the Position: Working with a volunteer Driver to deliver bags of pet food and supplies to 8-10 clients throughout SF Rider is responsible for navigation (with map & directions provided) and carrying food and supplies into clients’ homes Requirements: Must be at least 18 years old, or 13 years or older when accompanied by parent or guardian Complete an orientation Must be able to lift and carry up to 40 lbs Must be able to walk up and down stairs and/or use elevators Comfortable going into clients’ homes in various neighborhoods and types of housing/buildings/residences Comfortable engaging with clients and, possibly, their pets WHEN: Saturdays 10AM - 1PM. Volunteers can elect to be on on-call status or commit to one Saturday per month. WHERE: Starting at the PAWS office in the Mission District and going to clients’ homes in various neighborhoods in SF. HOW: For more information or to apply, please contact Volunteer Services at volunteerservices@shanti.org. Other ways to support the PAWS Pet Food Bank? Donate much needed items* including: dry & canned cat food (especially Fancy Feast), dry & canned dog food (especially Cesar’s), treats (especially cat treats), poop bags, clumping cat litter, leashes, toys and clothing (especially for small dogs.) *We accept food in its original packaging that has not passed its expiration or 'Best by’ date, and new or clean, gently used clothing and supplies.

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: AMERICAN CANCER SOCIEYT CANCER ACTION NETWORK LEADER

The primary responsibility of the ACS CAN leader is to recruit ACS CAN members and engage Relay For Life participants in fighting back through advocacy.

The ACS CAN (American Cancer Society Cancer Action Network(tm)) leader educates Relay For Life participants and the community about legislative efforts aimed to eradicate cancer as a major health concern and to recruit a grassroots army of advocacy volunteers. Learn more here: www.ACSCAN.org

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

  • Ask the Event Leadership Team, Team Captains, participants, volunteers, and community to take action on the Society’s legislative priorities and ACS CAN materials and resources

  • Ensure that Event Leadership Team includes and considers advocacy education and activation in their plans by including ACS CAN education, celebrations, and member recruitment in their agenda when Relay participants are gathered.

  • Communicate and disseminate materials provided from ACS CAN to help raise awareness about cancer-related legislative priorities and to recruit ACS CAN members

  • Be willing to help mobilize Relay participants on ACS CAN’s legislative priorities, be able to articulate the benefits of becoming a member of ACS CAN, and be sure all Event Leadership Team members and Team Captains can do the same

  • Collaborate with registration leaders and accounting leaders to track ACS CAN membership forms/fees

  • Recruit Event Leadership Team, Team Captains, participants, and volunteers to join ACS CAN

  • Become an ACS CAN member

  • Promote ACS CAN membership and work with recognition lead to recognize current and new members

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!

CLIMB WITH US TO NEW HEIGHTS!

We have an awesome event for those interested in volunteer opportunities - Fight For Air Climb on Sat. April 22, 2017 in SF. We really need volunteers to join us to fight lung disease (asthma, COPD, emphysema and lung cancer). This event raises funds for research, education and patient programs to improve the lives of those living with lung disease.

We need volunteers in order to make this a successful event. The volunteer opportunities are numerous but here's a brief list: Registration, Volunteer Check-in, Plaza Assistant and Food/Beverage Attendants.

Volunteers can sign-up at www.fightforairclimb.org or email me at cecilia.haywood@lung.org

opportunities.description:
About Jumpstart

Jumpstart is a national early education organization working toward the day every child in America enters kindergarten prepared to succeed. Jumpstart delivers a research-based and cost-effective program by training college students and community volunteers to serve preschool-aged children in low-income neighborhoods. Through a proven curriculum, these children develop the language and literacy skills they need to be ready for kindergarten, setting them on a path for longtime success.

Corporate Engagment

Jumpstart hosts material resource creation events known as "work-parties" to support our preschoolers’ learning in the classroom and at home. These work-parties are held at the offices of Jumpstart’s corporate partners during regular business hours. Hosting a work party is a fun, casual way for colleagues to give back to their communities while accommodating busy schedules.


What resources are created at work parties?

Jumpstart recognizes that families are children’s first and most important teachers. We seek to involve families in Jumpstart’s work to support their children’s language and literacy development by providing opportunities for families to extend learning from Jumpstart sessions into the home whenever possible. We utilize work parties to create materials for literacy kits and home libraries for families to extend their child’s learning at home.

A literacy kit is a set of activities that are designed to reinforce language and literacy skills children are learning in Jumpstart session. Each kit is filled with fun activities including basic instructions for using these materials in games that family members can play at home. Kits may include bingo games, letter matching boards, picture and word cards, basic writing materials and blank books.

opportunities.description:
Tenderloin Housing Clinic serves over 3,000 formerly homeless adults by offering permanent housing opportunities in 22 Single Room Occupancy (SRO) hotels throughout San Francisco. Our staff relies on assistance from community volunteer groups to ensure each hotel meets our standards and helps make our tenants feel at home.

Volunteer opportunities with THC consist of one-day group activities where volunteers will clean and repaint common areas and complete various beautification projects within the hotel.

This is a great opportunity for corporate groups to engage in team-building while giving back to the local community! Interested groups will be connected to THC’s Project Manager at Hands on Bay Area to complete the registration process.

PLEASE NOTE: While we truly appreciate your interest in THC, unfortunately at this time we are NOT ABLE TO ACCOMMODATE INDIVIDUAL VOLUNTEERS. We are only able to offer volunteer opportunities to groups ranging in size from 10-50.

No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: MARKETING & COMMUNITY OUTREACH LEADER

The marketing leader creates, develops, & implements marketing & publicity to raise awareness of the Relay For Life event.

Individuals in this role will be able to coordinate, prepare, & implement a publicity & marketing strategy. Additionally, they will be familiar with or willing to learn how to utilize the resources & tools available to promote & market the event.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:

  • Assist online & social communications lead in cultivating relationships with contacts in media outlets & other promotional organizations
  • Plan & implement strategies for event promotion, marketing materials, & resources
  • Assist online & social communications lead in messaging for online promotion, including email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
  • Provide opportunities for Event Leadership Team, Team Captains, participants, & volunteers to share stories.
  • Develop relationships & serve as the primary contact with media outlets & other organizations with a board reach including newspapers, radio, television outlets, etc.
  • Leverage relationships with business contacts & other supporters to promote the Relay For Life event & Event Leadership Team efforts.
  • Works with the Experience Lead on the Event Leadership Team as well as the American Cancer Society Community Manager to ensure that all marketing materials are available for the Event Leadership Team & teams in a timely manner.
  • Meets monthly or bi-monthly with Experience Lead to discuss goals & progress

opportunities.description:
We are celebrating the 15th year anniversary of La Colectiva (lacolectivasf.org), and we are looking for an extremely organized person who is enthusiastic about throwing a Quinceañera party! The ideal candidate has experience organizing events and can effectively collaborate, plan and execute on the multiple priorities associated with making things happen. This is going to be fun!!!

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective (DLP/WC) is a grassroots-organized program deeply rooted in the community with strong support of key stakeholders. For over 20 years, the DLP/WC has been extremely successful at uniting, empowering, and organizing immigrant workers for dignified work and fair wages in San Francisco. Workers are organized in two collectives, one of men and one of women, for building collective power, developing skills, and operating a shared business.

Members of the collectives work united and organized to eradicate the injustices that affect them, while building their dignity, power and leadership. They learn, work,and participate in immigrant worker movements because they share a vision of having the same opportunities and rights than any other worker. The collectives are co-founders and leaders in the National Day Labor Organizing Network, National Domestic Workers Alliance, Progressive Workers Alliance, California Domestic Workers Coalition, Jobs with Justice, San Francisco Rising, among others.

Position Objective: This position co-organizes events from conception through to completion. You will work in tandem with another experienced organizer (read: you'll have solid support).


This position is part of a volunteer team that supports the fundraising initiatives of the Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective. It is directed to transforming the lives of low-wage immigrant workers at a personal level, in order to develop leaders who can promote the dignity of their work and transform the industries in which they work. This position has the following.

Responsibilities:

  • Research market, identify event opportunities and generate interest

  • Plan, design and produce events while managing all project delivery elements within time limits

  • Conduct research, gather information and negotiate contracts/donations prior to closing deals

  • Propose ideas to improve event quality and outcomes

  • Organize and manage all event’s details such as decor, catering, entertainment, transportation, location, invitee list, special guests, equipment, promotional material etc

  • Ensure compliance with insurance, legal, health and safety obligations

  • Specify staff and volunteer requirements and coordinate their activities

  • Support the marketing and promotion and publicize event

  • Proactively handle any arising issues and troubleshoot any emerging problems on the event day

  • Conduct pre- and post - event evaluations and report on outcomes


Desired Skills:

  • Event/project management experience

  • Portfolio of previously organized events

  • Highly organized

  • Highly motivated

  • Excellent time management and communication skills

  • Sales skills and ability to build productive business relationships

  • Ability to manage multiple projects independently

  • Abilit to work under very tight deadlines

  • MS Office proficiency
opportunities.tags: Social Justice, workers, collective, Human Rights, women, volunteers, equal rights, Raza, Immigrants, dignity, Community

opportunities.description:
UniversalGiving(r) is an award-­‐winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing vetted projects all over the world. Unique to UniversalGiving, 100% goes directly to the cause. UniversalGiving Corporate provides Strategy, Operations, and NGO Vetting to scale companies’ CSR programs in more than 120 countries; our Corporate Services allow us to become self-­‐sustaining. UniversalGiving has been featured on the homepage of BusinessWeek, Oprah.com, CBS, The Wall Street Journal, and The New York Times.


The CSR Returnee will be responsible for performing critical CSR Research, preparing outreaches to potential partners, maintaining the Corporate Strategy Spreadsheet, and writing proposals. We are seeking an experienced professional who can work closely with our CEO to expand UniversalGiving’s global presence in CSR. Our ideal candidate has significant experience in sales and client management. He/she is ready to give back to a smart, efficient, and globally impactful nonprofit. Excellent communication skills, relationship-­‐building skills and attention to detail are required.

UniversalGiving’s Returnship Program offer exciting opportunities to those wishing to make a significant impact and contribution to our global communities. Returnships are for experienced professionals returning to the workforce who desire to gain new skills, change professions, or simply yearning to give back.


 Responsibilities:

  • Develop key corporate partnerships

  • Craft communications: outreach and follow up with potential partners

  • Maintain and update Corporate documents on Google Drive

  • Post CSR news, trends, and client accomplishments on Social Media

  • Manage junior team members

  • Track and communicate team progress and performance With proven track record:

  • Attend meetings with prospective and current corporate partners

  • Research and recommend best practices and integrate them into CSR plan

  • Lead the Corporate Business Unit and manage Corporate interns


 Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree

  • Minimum 5 years corporate business experience

  • Demonstrated success in client service and relationship management

  • Success in managing teams

  • Experience with field offices, remote workforces or with remote clients

  • Excellent verbal and communication skills

  • Critical attention to detail

  • Flexibility and adaptability to change

  • Understanding of the global CSR landscape and best practices is a plus

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) and Google applications (some training provided)

  • Prior experience with Salesforce is a plus


 Benefits:

  • Contribute your high-­‐level skills to UniversalGiving’s mission;

  • Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship nonprofit that has a global impact

  • Gain exposure, and experience in the nonprofit industry

  • Increase your understanding of global issues

  • Work directly with our CEO, Pamela Hawley

  • Collaborate with a positive and innovative team

  • Network with other for-­‐profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment


Duration: Minimum of 15-­‐20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. Ideal candidates are available to work in our San Francisco office 2-­‐3 days/week (Monday through Friday) with the possibility of some work completed remotely. As this is a leadership position, the majority of work should be done in-­‐office.

We value our interns and volunteers and take these positions very seriously. For this reason, we ask for a $200 fully refundable retainer to secure your position. This check pays for the your seat in our coworking space, professional training and management guidance that you will receive. Because our interns are such an integral part of UniversalGiving, we implemented this policy several years ago to ensure the accountability of all team members. We return your full deposit on the last day of your internship. Please do not hesitate to contact us with further questions!


 About UniversalGiving

UniversalGiving(r) is an award-­‐winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model(tm) to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause.

UniversalGiving Corporate consults with Fortune 500 companies on the Strategy, Operations and NGO Vetting for their international giving and volunteering programs all over the world. Some clients include Cisco, Symantec, Fluor, Sabre, Gap, BHP Billiton, RSF Social Finance, and inovia.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled on CBS and in FOX Business Network, and has also been featured inBusinessWeek, Fast Company, CSRWire, WomenEntrepreneur, Oprah.com, NBC News, The Christian Science Monitor, The New York Times, The Financial Times, MarketWatch, CNNMoney.com, Change.org and See Change Magazine. UniversalGiving has been featured three times on Great Nonprofits’ annual Top Nonprofits lists and is a Webby Award Honoree.

CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute. She is a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR.

UniversalGiving’s Mission: To connect people to quality giving and volunteer opportunities worldwide.

UniversalGiving’s Vision: "To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life"(r)



 Testimonial

"I came to UniversalGiving at a time when I was looking for a way to have more meaning with my work. After years in management consulting, finance, and then home raising two young children, I was ready to give back to the world in a different way. I began as a volunteer in their Returnship program and four years later, am leading Operations. UniversalGiving is a professional environment that has given me meaning, experience in new realms, and flexibility in my work schedule. I am so proud to be a part of this amazing team that is doing great things in the world."

Adriana Rabkin, Former Senior Manager of Operations

"UniversalGiving is committed to providing corporations like Cisco with global strategy, policy, operations and rigorous NGO vetting that supports operational excellence. They strengthen our CSR programs locally and around the world."

Michael Yutrzenka, Senior Director, Corporate Affairs Cisco Foundation

To Apply:

Please email your resume, cover letter, a brief writing sample, and three professional references to jobs@universalgiving.org with "CSR Returnship" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please.

UniversalGiving(r) is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations.


 Follow us on social media:

  • UniversalGiving’s website

  • Like us on Facebook

  • Follow Us on Twitter: @UniversalGiving and @PamelaHawley

  • Follow Us on Pinterest: @UniversalGiving

  • CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog: Living and Giving

opportunities.description:
The Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America is a national non-profit with the mission to find a cure for Crohn's Disease and ulcerative colitis. We host an annual Gala in San Francisco at the Ritz Carlton Hotel and need some help as we procure auction items and sell tickets to the event.

  • We're looking for some volunteers to come into our office to help with the following: --Manage auction process including: mailings, follow-up phone calls and emails, package organization, copywriting for packages, inventory donations, and donation acknowledgments.
  • Work with CCFA staff to effectively promote the event via media and social media channels

We could use help on a weekly basis. If you are interested in ONLY one part of the volunteer work we are happy to focus your projects on your interests. We would also love to have a weekly or bi-weekly volunteer who can join us in our office from now until the event on April 21st.

opportunities.description:
This position negotiates and advocates for workers’ fair wages. It is part of a volunteer team that supports the operations of the worker center. It is directed to transforming the lives of low-wage immigrant workers at a personal level, in order to develop leaders who can promote the dignity of their work and transform the industries in which they work. This position has the following responsibilities.


Responsibilities:


  • Receive and review wage-theft claims made by workers in a timely manner

  • Interview affected worker(s) to better understand the details of the claim

  • Contact employers involved in the claim to better understand their perspective on the matter

  • Act as a fair negotiator between employer and worker, advocating for fair wages

  • Document the case progress as conversations move forward

  • Follow up with employer and worker with negotiation outcomes so they take appropriate actions

  • Confirm with worker that both worker and employer have taken agreed actions

  • Make appropriate internal and external case referrals if/when needed

  • Document case outcome in a timely manner

  • Report cases statuses weekly at member meetings


Expected Commitment:


  • 2 hours per week in-person to report case status

  • 4 hours per week remotely to process claims


Desired Skills:


  • Highly developed communication and negotiation skills

  • Bilingual in Spanish and English

  • Commitment to social justice, specifically worker and immigrant rights

  • Compassionate and caring approach to supporting immigrant workers

  • High level of professionalism

  • Extremely organized and highly motivated

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective (DLP/WC) is a grassroots-organized program deeply rooted in the community with strong support of key stakeholders. For 25 years, the DLP/WC has been extremely successful at uniting, empowering, and organizing immigrant workers for dignified work and fair wages in San Francisco. Workers are organized in two collectives, one of men and one of women, for building collective power, developing skills, and operating a shared business.

Members of the collectives work united and organized to eradicate the injustices that affect them, while building their dignity, power and leadership. They learn, work,and participate in immigrant worker movements because they share a vision of having the same opportunities and rights than any other worker. The collectives are co-founders and leaders in the National Day Labor Organizing Network, National Domestic Workers Alliance, Progressive Workers Alliance, California Domestic Workers Coalition, Jobs with Justice, San Francisco Rising, among others.

In 2015, the DLP/WC started an exciting reorganization process with the objective of establishing a more sustainable and scalable model that enhances the impact of the program in the lives of immigrant workers.

opportunities.description:
Volunteers needed: Psychotherapy clinic and non-profit organization

(Locations throughout the Bay Area for working with clients; supervision in San Francisco)

Ideal candidates: undergraduates, or recent graduates looking to go on to graduate school in psychology, social work, nursing or related helping professions; current graduate students needing/ wanting more clinical experience. Work consists of direct service, hands-on, with certain clients needing in-home help with organizing and de-cluttering.

Types of tasks involved:

Hands-on help, in-home, with clients with hoarding and cluttering issues, help them organize, help them manage anxiety enough to lessen their clutter, and eventually come to develop better organizational systems to reduce clutter in the future.

[See shows "Hoarders," A&E TV and "Hoarding: Buried Alive," TLC, for examples]

Background information: Clients with hoarding & cluttering issues tend to have anxiety or depression, may have trauma backgrounds, may be struggling with PTSD, OCD, ADD - various mental health issues that make it more difficult for them to make decisions, and/or have full access to their executive and organizing functions. The volunteer assists the client by offering a calm presence, a gentle "centering" capacity, that guides the client toward making decisions that would otherwise be difficult, as well as helping the client move toward, examine, and ultimately work through resistances to letting go of things that are no longer needed. The volunteer helps the client work toward goals in a step-by-step way, working through anxiety and/or OCD along the way.

Necessary: Must have own car, must have ability to be fragrance-free; must be sensitive, personable, patient, be organized oneself. One hour weekly supervision available (and required) by clinic director (psychologist), by advanced graduate students and/or by MFT interns with more experience with this population. Ideally applicant would need to be able to offer minimum of 4-5 hours/week (3-4 hours with the client, 1 hour supervision).

Benefit(s) to you: If you are an undergraduate applying to graduate school, this offers experience you can put on your resume, and a letter of recommendation; you might be able to get college credits for an "independent project;" if you are already in a graduate program (MFT or MSW or psychology), you might be able to use the clinical hours and hours of supervision for a practicum placement, etc.

Contact: Deborah Brenner-Liss, Ph.D., Laurel Heights Psychotherapy Associates,

Cell phone: 415-608-6307, to set up appointment; send resume and letter of interest to AptedSF@aol.com.

Specific locations in which we need volunteers at present: East Bay (Richmond); San Francisco, Pacifica

Additional opportunity: If someone is willing to work in the East Bay, and wants some hours worth of pay (even if it is only minimal wage, approximately $11/hour), up to 12 hours a week could be paid. This niche would require someone willing to become IHSS certified (In Home Support Services). IHSS requires a background check, fingerprints, and a 4-hour training.

Personal qualifications: The person needs to be patient, considerate, flexible, responsible and reliable. (For the particular client we are looking to help, the person who would be hired would need to like cats, or at least not be allergic to them.) The person would need to be able to show up on time, keep commitments, and have their own car.

Job duties would include: Helping the client go grocery shopping, do cooking or at least meal prep; cleaning, vacuuming, helping the client with organizing. Driving to grocery shopping, running errands, and possibly to some appointments.
opportunities.tags: Organizational skills, supportive help; interpersonal skills

Children's Walk Guide

Every school year, our children's walk guides introduce young children to the wonders of the natural world, often for the first time. Experience the Botanical Garden through a child's eyes and connect them with the environment through an exploration of the plants, animals and insects that flourish here. Our youth education department serves nearly 6,000 schoolchildren grades K-5 every year.

Trainings offered 2x per year, starting in February and September. The next training begins September 19, 2017.

12 Tuesdays
9am-12:30pm
County Fair Building

http://sfbotanicalgarden.org/volunteer/childrens-docent-training.html

opportunities.description:
As most of us learned from our parents and our grandparents, there is nothing more nourishing to the body and the soul than a home cooked meal. But for seniors living on a fixed income in a city that has become increasingly more expensive to live in, even fresh, nutritious food is a luxury many cannot afford. You can help us change that!

The Home Delivered Groceries Program serves homebound and disabled seniors with fresh fruits, vegetables, dry goods and proteins- everything they need to make nutritious and delicious meals, and to restore the dignity of being able to cook for themselves. Every Wednesday, Meals on Wheels volunteers assemble a week's worth of groceries and deliver them to 200 seniors. The problem is there are many more in need.

We need drivers! By committing to just 1-2 hours a week, you can help improve the lives of up to 20 seniors.

Meals On Wheels of San Francisco (MOWSF) is a local organization that has been serving meals to homebound seniors since 1970. As the largest meal provider in San Francisco, we deliver more than one million each year. We also provide social work, nutrition counseling and volunteer support to almost 3,000 seniors annually. Our goal is to "Nourish the Whole Person."
opportunities.tags: homebound, Food insecurity, Drivers, food delivery, senior, seniors, Driving, disabled, nutrition

Join Education First and be a leader in your local community. For 20 years, Education First has been providing college scholarships to underserved communities and has awarded $700,000 to date. Visit www.educationfirst.org

We are specifically looking for an Regional Events Chair: Serves as primary lead for local fundraising events. This may include happy hours, beer or wine tastings, silent and live auctions and/or fun runs.


Local Volunteer exceptions:

  • Serve on local team and assist with regional activities of fundraising, interviewing applicants, and awarding scholarships
  • Be a Regional Chair (optional) and lead one of the major activities described above for your city
  • Run for a national board position (optional) and take an increasing level of responsibility
  • Stay in touch with our scholars while they attend college

The best candidates are self-motivated, have a passion for the cause, graduated from college, and are familiar with Microsoft Office products.

These positions have a time commitment varying between 3 and 8 hours per month and averages around 4. Positions are designed so they can be held by those with other commitments.

For more information on volunteering check out:
http://www.educationfirst.org/become-a-volunteer.php

opportunities.description:
Education Francaise Bay Area provides a bilingual, multicultural francophone K-12 education, opening doors and minds to the world.

We currently have an exciting volunteering opportunity for a part-time HR Assistant (20 hours per week). The position is based in our office in downtown San Francisco (near Embarcadero BART) and under direct supervision of our HR Director.

Tasks and responsibilities include:

  1. Assists drafting job descriptions, and placing ads: including in the applicant tracking system.
  2. Prescreens candidates, and assists conducting job interviews with the hiring managers for all three programs.
  3. Checks employment documentation and eligibility.
  4. Creates and maintains employee files and personnel records.
  5. Prepares and conducts new employee orientation.

Other projects may include:

Assisting with event planning and coordination

Skills and experience required:

  • 1 - 2 years of progressive Human Resource experience
  • Fluency in French language a plus.
  • Deep respect for confidentiality: will handle sensitive and confidential situations.
  • Ability to work harmoniously in a team atmosphere.

Benefit: Lunches and commute expenses will be reimbursed.

opportunities.description:
RRRcomputer.org's vision is "1 Child, 1 Computer" to become a reality. Our mission is to reclaim, refurbish, reuse computers from recycling to reuse for education for low income K-12 kids. We reduce computer waste by refurbishing the computers to put back into circulation for the kids to use for internet search for research, and doing their homework assignment at home. The computers that are going to recycling is still useful for their needs. We do our part in saving the planet and improve the education of children.

RRRcomputer.org is looking for Business Board Member to help with the business aspect of the non profit operation. We need to be mindful of our organization to be sustainable and thriving in order to help as many childrens and the public as much as possible. Thank you very much for your help.

Hue

Role Requirements:

  • Experience in corporate finances
  • Some experience in nonprofit finances

opportunities.description:
"You can dream, create, design, and build the most wonderful place in the world... But it requires people to make the dream a reality." Walt Disney

Being a volunteer at The Walt Disney Family Museum is a fun and rewarding experience. As a volunteer you will be helping to ensure every guest visiting the museum feels inspired, educated and entertained.

Volunteers support the museum in so many wonderful ways, from assisting in the galleries and store, to helping out at our public programs and membership events, interacting with visitors in the Learning Center, ensuring our exhibition openings and special event nights go smoothly, facilitating the important work of our education programs, working with special projects, being ambassadors for the museum at off-site events.

Your Welcome to Volunteering will include orientation and training, and when you begin volunteering, you’ll be part of a dedicated team of other volunteers and staff. You’ll have many opportunities to add to your understanding of Walt and his remarkable life story and achievements, access specialized instruction and training, and enjoy engaging with and assisting visitors from all over the world.

As your relationship with the museum continues and develops, you can explore all the different ways in which your support as a volunteer is vital to our ongoing success.

For more comprehensive descriptions of volunteer roles please visit www.waltdisney.org/participate/volunteer

opportunities.description:
Make-A-Wish grants the wishes of children with life-threatening medical conditions to enrich the human experience with hope, strength, and joy.

Wish granter volunteers go in and interview the wish kids to determine their wishes, and then act as a liaison between the families and the Make-a-Wish staff to help make the wishes happen.

We are looking for people who are bilingual in English and Spanish, who can help interviewing wish families in Spanish. Bilingual wish granters must be fluent in written and spoken Spanish.

We are looking for volunteers who can travel to various parts of the city to help with the wish granting. We are especially looking for volunteers who are willing to travel to San Mateo County and the East Bay.

opportunities.description:
Visual Aide Organizer ~ SF Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective (DLP/WC) is a grassroots-organized program deeply rooted in the community with strong support of key stakeholders. For over 20 years, the DLP/WC has been extremely successful at uniting, empowering, and organizing immigrant workers for dignified work and fair wages in San Francisco. Workers are organized in two collectives, one of men and one of women, to build collective power, develop skills, and operate a business.

Members of the collectives work together to eradicate the injustices that affect day laborers and domestic workers, fostering an organized environment where all workers can build their dignity, power and leadership. Members share a vision of a community where day laborers and domestic workers have the same opportunities and rights than any other worker. They accomplish this by offering each other opportunities to learn, work and participate in the movement of immigrant and domestic workers. The collectives are co-founders and leaders in the National Day Labor Organizing Network, National Domestic Workers Alliance, Progressive Workers Alliance, California Domestic Workers Coalition, Jobs with Justice, San Francisco Rising, among others.

In 2015, the DLP/WC started an exciting reorganization process with the objective of establishing a more sustainable and scalable model that enhances the impact of the program in the lives of immigrant workers.

The DLP/WC is looking for a Visual Aide Organizer to organize information -- in Spanish -- with visual aides while also designing, printing, hanging materials. Option to work in tandem with our Graphic Designer if applicant doesn’t have this skill and/or prefers to work in tandem. The ideal candidate is a creative individual with advanced skills in organizing information in a visual way.

Position Objective: This position supports the internal communication of the program, which is directed to transforming the lives of low-wage immigrant workers at a personal level, in order to develop leaders who can promote the dignity of their work and transform the industries in which they work.

Responsibility:

This position has the responsibility of organizing information -- in Spanish -- with visual aides while also designing, printing, hanging materials.

Expected Commitment:

  • Entire project is estimated at 40 hours total and to begin as soon as possible.

Desired Skills:

  • Extremely creative and visual

  • Skills in graphic design techniques, systems and tools

  • High level of professionalism and ability to meet deadlines on time

  • Commitment to social justice, specifically worker and immigrant rights

  • Compassionate and caring approach to supporting immigrant workers

  • Fluent in Spanish

  • Extremely organized and highly motivated

ABOUT THE DLP/WC

Founded in 1991 and inspired by the socio-ecologic model, the DLP/WC unites, empowers and organizes immigrant workers to access dignified work and fair wages by building collective power, developing skills, and operating businesses. The DLP/WC power center offers on-demand labor for environmentally-conscious cleaning services, childcare, patient care, moving, hauling, painting, yard work, handyman repairs, installations and more.

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective is a program of Dolores Street Community Services, an equal-opportunity employer that seeks applicants of the greatest diversity possible, including women, people of color, lesbian/ gay/ bisexual/ transgender individuals, people living with HIV and persons with disabilities.
opportunities.title: Visual Aide Organizer

opportunities.description:
We offer many flexible opportunities to volunteer at AgeSong (www.agesong.com) elder communities in San Francisco and Oakland.


Our mission: to create theraputic environments; programs that serve people in being who they are.

Our vision: to reassert the value of aging and of being an elder.

Our care is rooted in a holistic and comprehensive approach and volunteers support the emotional and spiritual well being of community members through one-on-one contact and group activities and outings.


Options include:

  • Join our companionship program and be paired up with a resident to spend time Do something you both enjoy (chess, card games, a stroll, going out for coffee, making art).
  • Lead a group in art, music, or any other skill you have.
  • Assising us on outings to the opera, ballet, parks, museums and other cultural events.
  • Recieve all the training and support you need and enjoy a unusual and satisfying opportunity to connect with an elder.

Contact today: Sally Gelardin, Enrichment Director, Sallyg@AgeSong.com

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: LUMINARIA LEAD

The role of the luminaria lead is to promote awareness and sales of luminaria bags in honor or in memory of those who have been touched by cancer in the community. (We can teach you all about luminaria!!)

Individuals in this role are creative, organized, and able to coordinate logistics in order to assist in the development and execution of the Luminaria Ceremony at the event. This ceremony is an instrumental piece of Relay For Life events; it’s a time to truly remember loved ones effected by this disease.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:

  • Educate Event Leadership Team and Relay participants about the importance of the Luminaria Ceremony and its fundraising potential

  • Assist ceremonies lead in planning and implementation of Luminaria Ceremony

  • Collaborate with fundraising lead to host pre-event and day-of-event luminaria fundraising sales and production efforts

  • Ensure that Event Leadership Team members include and consider luminaria integration in their strategy planning

  • Assist community champions and team ambassadors in their efforts to promote and sell luminaria within the community

  • Meet monthly or bi-monthly with the experience lead to discuss goals and progress

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!
opportunities.tags: Sales, luminaria, ceremonies, memory, Marketing, cancer survivors, Honor

opportunities.description:
Get eye to eye with a butterfly in the exhibit Butterflies & Blooms coming to the Conservatory of Flowers in Golden Gate Park this fall. The popular exhibit returns by overwhelming demand to San Francisco’s beloved Victorian greenhouse, transforming its Special Exhibit gallery into a beautiful and intimate cottage garden aflutter with hundreds of butterflies on the wing including magnificent monarchs, western swallowtails, painted ladies and more.

Exhibit volunteers talk to visitors about the mysterious process of metamorphosis, butterfly anatomy, and the pollinator's critical role in the life cycle of plants. This volunteer position is for you if you're comfortable approaching and talking with visitors of all ages.

The Conservatory requests that volunteers commit to two shifts per month for one year. Shifts are available from 10:00-1:00 or 1:00-4:00 Tuesday-Sunday. In return, the Conservatory offers volunteers, free entry during regular hours, free lectures and social events, and a discount in the gift shop.
