opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: LOGISTICS LEAD

The logistics lead is primarily responsible for providing a safe, comfortable, and seamless experience for all Relay For Life participants.

Individuals in this role are organized and pay strong attention to detail in order to manage a comprehensive event execution plan that represents the mission and tradition of the American Cancer Society Relay For Life event within the community.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:

  • Organize and create implementation plan for site selection, event schedule, event layout, signage, electrical and mechanical materials, restrooms, trash and signage, tents, safety, risk management, contingency location, security, medical support, set-up, and clean-up needs

  • Collaborate with community champions and projects manager to recruit and train day-of-event volunteers

  • Assist with coordination of hospitality planning and execution

  • Ensure all American Cancer Society risk management standards, guidelines, and procedures are adhered to

  • Work with the ACS Community Manager, event lead, and experience lead to determine appropriate vendors and to secure necessary items for logistic needs

  • Meet monthly or bi-monthly with the experience lead to discuss goals and progress

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!

opportunities.description:
Become a docent and share the wonders of San Francisco Botanical Garden with visitors from all over the Bay area and the world! We are seeking volunteers who are interested in plants and who enjoy talking to people to become docents and lead Interpretation Stations, a 2 hour interactive display in the Garden on weekends.

Volunteers attend an 8 week training, taking place on Saturday mornings and Thursday evenings. After completing the training, we ask that you commit to leading at least one Interpretation Station per month. Next training starts March 4, 2017.

http://www.sfbotanicalgarden.org/volunteer/adult-docent-training.html

opportunities.description:
What is Breakthrough San Francisco?

Breakthrough San Francisco is an educational non-profit that supports young people in San Francisco on the path to college and trains outstanding college students for education careers. We are looking for adults, college students, high school students, and SFDS eighth graders to volunteer in our after-school program with academically motivated 5 th-8 th grade students from underserved communities around San Francisco. All programming takes place at San Francisco Day School (350 Masonic Avenue at Golden Gate Avenue). All volunteers receive extensive training and ongoing support from Breakthrough’s program staff. Our students are motivated, enthusiastic, visionary, and talented.

What will volunteers be doing?

We are looking for tutors/teachers to work with enthusiastic 5th-8th graders through our comprehensive, tuition-free after-school program that promotes academic excellence, youth leadership, and intellectual growth for students from underserved communities around San Francisco.

What is the time commitment?

The commitment is one afternoon per week (Mon from 3:30-5:30pm, Tue from 4:00-6:00pm, Wed from 3:30-5:30pm, or Thu from 4:00-6:00pm), from the week of Feb. 6 to the week of May 1.

Most volunteers spend the first part of the afternoon tutoring. On Mon. and Wed., tutors are matched with particular students for the duration of the semester to allow for consistency and relationship building. On Tue. and Thur., tutors assist students during "study hall," where students complete their assignments, practice self-advocacy skills, and work on organization.

Volunteers high school age and older who are interested in an additional leadership opportunity can apply to teach a class as well. On Mon. and Wed., volunteers can teach a self-designed elective class of 5-10 fifth and sixth grade students. On Tue. returning volunteers can teach a math class to groups of 10-12 seventh grade students. Please note that the number of teaching positions is limited, and that those opting to teach are expected to spend time outside of Breakthrough preparing for their classes.

All volunteers will be required to attend a mandatory training on Wed. Feb. 1 from 5:00-8:00pm. Teachers will be required to attend an additional training on Thur. Feb. 2 from 5:00-8:00pm.

How to Apply

For more information, visit www.breakthroughsf.org/volunteer or email Sasha Mungal, Director of Volunteer Programs and Community Partnerships, at sasha@breakthroughsf.org.

The application can be found here: www.breakthroughsf.org/volunteer

Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis through Fri. Jan. 20, 2017

opportunities.description:
The Jeremiah O'Brien is an fully functional, living musuem that sails. As a tribute to both those that served in World War II and specifically the Merchant Mariners who risked it all to deliver cargo to Normandy for the D Day invatsion.

It takes the voluteer staff of the Jeremiah countless ours of maintenance, troubleshooting and repair to keep her in line with the maritime industry regualtions. He triple epansion engine and boilers are a marvel both to operate and to maintain. Volunteers with wide ranging engineering/ mechanical/ electrical backgrounds are needed.

Engineers that hold a MMC licence or credential are always needed.

opportunities.description: Come Volunteer as a grade school teacher at our 300 student grade school located in Kabula, Kenya. Volunteer Kenya is a grassroots volunteer organization located in western Kenya. We run 4 humanitarian aid programs: (1) Healthcare, (2) HIV/AIDS Education, (3) Education, (4) Microenterprise Development. Volunteer Kenya / ICODEI is a non-religious, non-political volunteer organization run through a partnership of past overseas volunteers and local Kenyans. Since 1998 we have had over 400 volunteers from around the world participate in our programs. We have volunteer placements open year round for 1-3 months time periods. Please visit our website to learn more about our volunteer opportunities www.volunteerkenya.org

opportunities.description:
Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. The Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research.


As a Hybrid Mobile App developer you will work with a team of developers, a Mobile App Dev Lead, Agile Project Manager, UX experts to build a new Patient-centric Mobile App for Rare Genomics.


Job Description:

  • The primary responsibility of our Hybrid Mobile Developer is to develop utility and functionality using Xcode, Ionic, JQuery, PhoneGap.

  • Design application and architecture

  • Test application performance. Test application and report issues with senior Staff.

  • Responsible for migrating the applications into a production environment

  • File management as well as assist in project documentation and code review from other team members.


Mobile development experience:

  • Experience with hybrid tools\frameworks\API’s such as PhoneGap, Ionic, jQuery Mobile, Dojo Mobile, Cordova, etc.

  • Experience developing mobile applications for iOS (Swift or Objective C) and / or Android

  • Experience having deployed developed apps to Google Play or Apple App Store

  • Familiarity with one or more beta app framework such as TestFlight, HockeyApp, Google Play Beta, AppBlade, Appaloosa, etc.

  • Commitment to Rare Genomics values of attitude, commitment, and excellence

  • Ideal Candidate would have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, or science-related field or equivalent experience.


General Assembly candidates are welcome to Apply to this position.

Mobile development experience: Experience with hybrid tools\frameworks\API’s such as PhoneGap, Ionic, jQuery Mobile, Dojo Mobile, Cordova, etc. Experience developing mobile applications for iOS (Swift or Objective C) and / or Android Experience having deployed developed apps to Google Play or Apple App Store Familiarity with one or more beta app framework such as TestFlight, HockeyApp, Google Play Beta, AppBlade, Appaloosa, etc. Commitment to Rare Genomics values of attitude, commitment, and excellence Ideal Candidate would have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, or science-related field or equivalent experience. General Assembly candidates are welcome to Apply to this position .

opportunities.description:
RRRcomputer.org's vision is "1 Child, 1 Computer" to become a reality. Our mission is to reclaim, refurbish, reuse computers from recycling to reuse for education for low income K-12 kids. We reduce computer waste by refurbishing the computers to put back into circulation for the kids to use for internet search for research, and doing their homework assignment at home. The computers that are going to recycling is still useful for their needs. We do our part in saving the planet and improve the education of children.


We are looking for Word Press Specialists to help with our website design and improvement. We are looking for constant improvement in our Word Press site and to make it lean and load fast. If you have the time to help, please contact us.


Hue

opportunities.description:
Our Volunteer Program

Tunnell Center volunteers are there to assist the activities department, deliver resident mail, hold a hand and listen, help facilitate refreshments and social dining program. Volunteers are there to support the activities department to bring joy and amusement into the life of the residents. No matter what your skills, talents or motivation, we have opportunities for you to help.

Being a Kindred Tunnell Center Volunteer means

  • Having concern for others
  • Practicing tolerance, flexibility, patience
  • Being mature with self-understanding
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Being able to maintain confidentiality
  • Being sympathetic/empathetic, sincere, sensitive
  • Dependability
  • Acceptance of moral and cultural differences
  • Fostering a positive atmosphere within the facility
  • Having the ability to accept supervision and evaluation
  • Being at least 16-years-old
  • Annual TB testing
  • Submit to and pass a criminal background screening
  • Submit to and pass a drug screening

There are no restrictions in regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, ability or national origin.

Patient Visitor Volunteers:

Make friendly visits to patients within the facility, and provide companionship and support to the patients and their families.

Pet Therapy Volunteers:

Make supportive visits to patients with their registered therapy dogs. The pet therapy volunteer team must be registered or be willing to become registered through an organization such at Therapy Dog, Inc., Therapy Dog International, etc.

Other Specialty and Professional Volunteers:

Volunteers who want to provide specific support including music, art/crafts, spiritual support, handyman, etc. Additionally, those who want to share professional skills such as art and music therapists, beauticians and barbers and other professional services are welcomed.


Volunteers can choose when and how they give their time but must commit to volunteering for at least 3 months.

opportunities.description: The Reach and Rise mission is to help at-risk youth overcome personal, social, and family challenges through a positive adult-child relationship. Reach and Rise offers 1-to-1 mentoring to at-risk youth in San Francisco/Marin/San Mateo/Alameda counties. We help children develop tools to cope with issues such as low self-esteem, family and peer conflicts, academic underachievement, and decision-making skills. We are unique in that we provide a 15-hour paraprofessional training to all mentors before matching, which prepares them to work successfully with at-risk youth by developing relationship-building skills, exploring issues facing at-risk youth, and strategies to handle difficult situations. Thorough ongoing support is provided by the coordinator who is a Marriage and Family Therapist Intern.

opportunities.description:
The Women’s Building (TWB) is a multi-cultural, multi-service center in the Mission District of San Francisco. TWB provides services and programs to empower women and girls, a home to a variety of non-profit organizations, and a community center with meeting spaces. Our mission is to provide women and girls with the tools and resources they need to achieve full and equal participation in society.


Hours: 4 hours per week during our opening hours: Monday-Friday from 10am to 5pm and Wednesday from 10-7pm.
Position starts: January 4th, 2016. (This position requires a 3 month minimum commitment and the attendance to a preview training of 2 hours in December)
Reports to: Jacqueline Moncada (Tax Program Coordinator) and Venecia Guzmán (Volunteer Coordinator)


Responsibilities include:
* Pre-Screen clients interested in doing their taxes at TWB.
* Schedule and confirm tax appointments
* Leave voice messages with the correct information
* Participate in outreach activities
* Assistance with giving out flyers or doing TWB or tax presentations
* Assist with specific projects for the Building.
* Perform general office duties (shredding, filing, organizing documents, send emails)
* Filing and organizing folders in the computer
* Answer incoming calls


Qualifications:
* Punctual and Reliable
* Attention to accuracy and detail
* Strong Reading and Organizational Skills as well as verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
* Technologically proficient; Excel, Google, PPT, Facebook
* Spanish language is a plus
* Cultural competence in working with diverse populations, including communities of color, immigrants, LGBT communities, and persons of various ages, socioeconomic backgrounds, health status, and abilities.


Benefits/ Leadership Development Goals:
* Gain experience serving a diverse community and meeting real needs of women and their families.
* Become familiar with the myriad non-profit and government services in the Bay Area.
* Develop knowledge of, and experience with, community services, administrative activities and programs operation.


To Apply: Please email a letter of interest, resume, and availability with TAX ASSISTANT VOLUNTEER as the subject line. Feel free to contact us if you have questions.
Contact: Venecia Guzmán
Email: crrassistant@womensbuilding.org
Phont: (415) 431-1180 ext. 11

opportunities.description:
We all know from experience how restless we can become when we are confined to bed during an illness or have to wait for a doctors' appointment. Magazines and other reading materials can be a great comfort and distraction during these times.

The Magazine and Communications Delivery Volunteer selects a variety of magazines from the supply in the Volunteer Services office and brings them to patients on nursing units, and distributes them to waiting rooms throughout the medical center. This volunteer also helps distribute other hospital newsletters and information about hospital programs.

opportunities.description:
The Riley Center seeks people committed to:

  • Supporting survivors of Domestic Violence.
  • Challenging all forms of oppression that contribute to intimate violence.
  • Developing valuable counseling, facilitation, and leadership skills.

We offer support to survivors through our hotline, community office, emergency shelter, transitional housing program and children's program. Our volunteer support is an essential piece in delivering these services! We believe that survivors are fully capable of making empowered choices for themselves. It is our role to support survivors in identifying and expanding their options by utilizing an intersectional feminist, peer-based model.

Attending our Basic Advocacy Training is required prior to volunteering. This training is done in collaboration with Woman, Inc; we are excited to come together to train new advocates and hope that in doing so we can create a greater sense of community. All sessions are mandatory.

Join us as we strive to create safer communities for all of us!

This training will be lead through online modules and three in-person 8-hour trainings on the Saturdays from 9:30am to 5:30pm in Spring 2017. The in-person dates are all mandatory. To apply, please fill out application here: http://goo.gl/forms/y1K2Mn8S1Y. For any questions or concerns, please contact Neda at nsaid@svdp-sf.org. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis. Applicants will receive training dates once they are finalized.

People of color, queer and trans identified, multilingual, of refugee/immigrant backgrounds and other marginalized/underserved communities encouraged to apply.

opportunities.description:
Mission Graduates' Extended Day Program (EDP) is an after-school program that focuses on positive youth development outcomes and helping needy children excel academically. The EDP serves 400 children across three sites, spanning K-5th grades.

The EDP at Marshall Elementary School (1575 15th Street, SF CA 94103) provides after-school programs from 2:40-6:00 pm Monday-Friday. Mission Graduates is seeking volunteers to give our students individual attention to help them succeed.

Volunteers help students with their class work, participate in our themed-lessons and academic enrichment activities and support our Classroom Coordinators with daily lesson plans.

Join us for Homework Help Mon-Thurs from 3:45-4:30 pm!

Note: The school year begins August 17, but we can get started on paperwork and have to you ready to begin!

---

Mission Graduates is a nonprofit organization that increases the number of K-12 students in San Francisco’s Mission District who are prepared for and complete a college education.

opportunities.description:
Boys & Girls Clubs of San Francisco is currently seeking volunteers to input and clean up our fundraising and volunteer program data. We have over 17,000 youth that go through our clubs each year and it is very important for us to keep high quality data so we can understand and support the youth to the best of our ability. This volunteer opporutnity is a great way to indirectly support youth in San Francisco through data management while getting a better understanding of how large youth serving non-profits compile and configue their fundraising and volunteer program data.

We ask that volunteers put in at least 3 hours per week between the hours of 9am and 5pm on Mon to Fri at the Don Fisher Clubhouse (380 Fulton St, San Francisco). We ask that volunteers commit to coming in weekly for a minimum of 4 weeks.

If you're interested in learning more, please either express interest through Volunteer Match or email Bret Carr at bcarr@kidsclub.org

Thanks so much for your support!

opportunities.description:
Help an amazing group of Russian-speaking seniors at the L'Chaim Center learn and practice English - http://www.jfcs.org/find-help/emigres/lchaim-health-center/.

We need volunteers to teach English to small groups of seniors - every week day except Wednesday. Ideal times to volunteer would be approximately 9:45 to 11:15 for the morning shift, and 3 to 4:30 for the afternoon shift. However, this is flexible.

This is a great opportunity to work in a small group with English learners at varied levels of English language proficiency. Perfect if you are training to be a TOEFL/TOESL teacher. But advanced training is not necessary - patience, kindness, enthusiasm, respect for elders, and love of the English language are.

There may also be opportunities to tutor English one-on-one.

Knowledge of Russian is preferred but not required.

opportunities.description:
Through our partnership with City College, the Arc San Francisco has a Job Club class taught by a CCSF faculty member located at CCSF downtown campus that is attended by Arc SF clients (adults with developmental disabilities). We need a volunteer who speaks Cantonese to assist with translation for a Cantonese speaking student who is searching for work.

Class topics include:
▪ Interview and communication skills
▪ Showing respect, helpfulness, and good attitudes at work
▪ Time management
▪ Job-hunting documents
▪ Job-hunting and workplace vocabulary
▪ Professional presentation and behavior for various work environments
▪ Addressing problems at work and in the job search - how to get help, asking questions, and handling emotional situations
▪ Supporting yourself and others in finding work and keeping work

Schedule:*
Tuesdays & Thursdays, 12:30 - 2:45
▪ 12:30 - 1:00: Individual and small group work
▪ 1:00 - 2:45: Whole class work

Beginning Tuesday, August 16
Ending Thursday, December 15
(Holidays: October 18, November 24)

Location:
CCSF Downtown Campus, room 818
(88 4th Street, at the corner of 4th and Mission)

*Hoping to find volunteers to commit to the entire semester and to come to at least one of the two classes each week. Time can be flexible, if you're interested please email gerkanat@thearcsf.org and we can chat about the time committment!

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: ACTIVITIES LEADER

The activities leader oversees all of the activities that take place during the Relay For Life event which may include choosing the type of activities and when they occur.

Individuals in this role are creative, organized, and know what it takes to have a good time. Additionally, individuals in this role are comfortable cultivating relationships with various and vast groups and organizations in the community that are willing to contribute to the implementation of creating a dynamic and exciting Relay For Life event!

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:

  • Plan and implement Relay For Life event activities, often related to cancer education and prevention

  • Collaborate with fellow volunteers regarding schedule of events

  • Meet monthly or bi-monthly with the experience leader to discuss goals and progress

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!
opportunities.tags: activities, games, Coordinating, Entertainment, event planning, management, kids
opportunities.title: Passionate about planning great interactive community events?  Join RFL of San Francisco!

Schedule of work is up to you. We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!

opportunities.description:
WOMEN IN COMEDY

SEEKING VOLUNTEERS TO JOIN THE COMMITTEE OF THE BRAND NEW SF CHAPTER

WELCOME

Welcome and thank you for your interest in donating your time as a volunteer executive committee member of the SF chapter to further Women In Comedy. Your time is so valuable to us and we appreciate you!

MISSION STATEMENT

So, what are we here to do? It is very important to us that you understand our Mission Statement to understand what we are here to accomplish:

"We believe in educating, empowering, and connecting powerful, ambitious, hilarious, and talented women in the comedy industry with resources that foster their professional development and advancement. Through our online and real-life community, we promote the creation of personal relationships, business relationships, and mentoring relationships in order to advance and increase women's voices, presence, and pay scale in the comedy industry."

VOLUNTEER AREAS

Our areas of volunteer opportunity are ever-evolving which means our volunteers will always be engaged in new and exciting activities. Currently, we are seeking well-connected, organized, and reliable volunteers to help our brand new SF Chapter. As the chapter grows you will help grow its network and facilitate live events in tandem with our Chicago hub.

Role: Head of Fundraising & Sponsorships for SF Chapter

The Chapter Head of Fundraising & Sponsorships is a part-time volunteer position responsible to carry out our mission statement to empower, connect, and advocate for women and girls seeking paid careers in comedy. The Head of Fundraising & Sponsorships is the head coordinator and responsible for securing all venues and sponsorships/donations for our 3 key events each year (put on in sister cities across the nation in Winter, Spring/Summer, Fall).

Duties may include but are not limited to:

  1. Spearhead and execute the sponsorship and venue donation process of 3 successful events in tandem with headquarters utilizing all Women In Comedy documents, timelines, and assignments.

  2. Attend weekly scheduled meetings with your committee.

  3. Answer and respond to phone calls, emails, and more from headquarters, volunteers, venues etc.

Our volunteer base is building and expanding. We are excited to be in the launching phase of the organization and this will afford opportunities for dedicated volunteers to become volunteer department heads in the near future as the organization evolves and we identify the top areas of need in our community. For now, we are asking volunteer event coordinators to help us replicate and facilitate events in various cities. Our opportunities allow our volunteers to help remotely as well if they cannot physically be present.

STEP ONE: Please email us at SF@womenincomedy.org OR respond to this posting
STEP TWO: Fill out our volunteer form: http://goo.gl/forms/mCLvC6NXNe

opportunities.description:
St. Luke's and Pacific Campus often serves patients who come from backgrounds of extreme economic deprivation. Sometimes these patients are discharged to the shelters or residence hotels with very limited resources. We do our utmost to provide these patients with a set of warm clothing to provide them with bare necessities at the very least.

Patient Clothes Closet Volunteers work under the direction of our Case Managers and select and arrange a variety of sizes of comfortable and durable apparel for men and women. Volunteers keep the patient clothes closet organized and help distribute clothing to various departments as needed.

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: COMMUNITY CHAMPION ROLE

Community champions are strong advocates for building the Relay For Life event within their communities.

Individuals in this role are a voice and outward-facing champion for the Relay For Life event in their community. They are outgoing and willing to speak to groups and individuals about the Relay For Life Program, with the goal of bringing more exposure, people, and fundraising to the event. This can be in the form of new teams, survivors, caregivers, or individuals. They are strong advocates for the Relay For Life movement within their community using their networks to bring more awareness to the event.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

  • Recruit teams and individuals to participate in the Relay For Life event

  • Assist survivors and caregivers lead with survivor and caregiver recruitment

  • Assist sponsorship lead with sponsor recruitment

  • Assist people lead with Event Leadership Team recruitment

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!

opportunities.description:
Habitat for Humanity is seeking to fill 100+ AmeriCorps positions in communities across the United States. These are full time (paid) service opportunities that range from 10 ½ - 12 months. As a Habitat AmeriCorps Member, you will receive a monthly living allowance, paid leave time, and access to other benefits.

Members begin service in January and February 2017.

What We Do

Everyone deserves a decent place to live. Here at Habitat, we build strength, stability, and self-reliance through shelter. We believe in providing access to decent and affordable housing, partnering with future Habitat homeowners to create a decent and affordable place to call home.

What You’ll Do

As a Habitat AmeriCorps member, you will be placed in one of our 100+ communities supported by our local Habitat affiliates. You will use your passion and commitment to service to meet the needs of our Habitat affiliates by engaging communities, building capacity, and increasing productivity. There are many individualized roles to choose from, so finding one that utilizes your strengths and unique skillset should be pretty easy. We offer roles ranging from construction to volunteer management to project development.

Minimum Requirements

18 years of age or older

U.S. citizen, national, or lawful permanent resident

Possess a high school diploma or GED equivalent (or agree to work towards one while serving)

Length

Positions terms range from 46 ½ weeks (Direct Service roles) to 52 weeks (Indirect Service roles.)

Living Allowance

$980 to $1,329 per month

AmeriCorps Education Award

This position is eligible for an AmeriCorps education award upon successful completion of the program. Value of education award is $5,775 (pre-tax)

Position Start Dates

January/February 2017

If this sounds like something you’d be interested in, we’d love to connect with you.

For more information and individual listings, visit: www.habitat.org/americorps.
opportunities.title: Habitat for Humanity AmeriCorps Positions – San Francisco

This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: CEREMONIES LEADER

The ceremonies leader oversees all ceremonies that take place throughout the Relay For Life event.

Individuals in this role are creative, organized, and familiar with or willing to learn about the mission, history, and tradition of the American Cancer Society ceremonies.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:

  • Plan & coordinate the Relay For Life event ceremonies

  • Collaborate with luminaria lead to develop and implement the Luminaria Ceremony

  • Collaborate with activities lead and entertainment lead regarding schedule of events

  • Collaborate with survivors and caregivers lead to ensure survivor and caregiver ceremonies are meaningful and impactful

  • Collaborate with mission lead and ACS CAN lead to develop and execute motivating opening, luminaria, and closing ceremonies that empowers participants to take action in their fight against cancer

  • Collaborate with Event Leadership Team to develop and execute Spirit of Relay For Life Ceremony (Optional)

  • Meet monthly or bi-monthly with the experience lead to discuss goals and progress

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

opportunities.description:
Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade.

Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life.

With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency.

No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm.

Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.

opportunities.description:
RRRcomputer.org's vision is "1 Child, 1 Computer" to become a reality. Our mission is to reclaim, refurbish, reuse computers from recycling to reuse for education for low income K-12 kids. We reduce computer waste by refurbishing the computers to put back into circulation for the kids to use for internet search for research, and doing their homework assignment at home. The computers that are going to recycling is still useful for their needs. We do our part in saving the planet and improve the education of children.

We are seeking a board member who is passionate about giving kids the technology so that they catch up to bridge the digital divide of the haves and have nots. Our mission is to divert computers from recycling to refurbish to be given to low income K-6 kids. They need computers at home to be competitive. Please join to shape and guide this organization toward technology equality.

Hue

opportunities.description:
Boys & Girls Clubs of San Francisco is looking for volunteers to support our Accounting team with entry level accounting tasks. Volunteers will work directly with out accounting team to help them with the various tasks of the day. Volunteers will start out with basic tasks and as they learn more, they'll have the opportunity to take on more advanced tasks.

We ask that volunteers commit to 5 to 10 hours per week for a minimum of 4 weeks. The timeframes you can volunteer are Mon - Fri from 9am - 5pm at our Don Fisher Clubhouse (380 Fulton St, San Francisco)

This is a great way to get accounting experience, build your resume, and support our local youth. If you're interested in learning more or signing up, please don't hesitate to express interest through volunteer match or email Bret Carr at bcarr@kidsclub.org.

Thanks so much for your interest!

The Head of Outreach, Media/Press, & Marketing is a part-time volunteer position responsible to carry out our mission statement to empower, connect, and advocate for women and girls seeking paid careers in comedy. The Head of Outreach, Media/Press, & Marketing is responsible for outreach to the community as well as ensuring a successful turnout to all events. This includes social media, email blasts, phone calls, posters, etc. This person must ensure that all materials align with our brand and message and must be approved by headquarters.

Duties may include but are not limited to:

  1. Ensure that all public relations are in good standing of our brand.
  2. Create a marketing plan for the upcoming year.
  3. Create an overview of all members recruited in the past year and their demographics.
  4. Ensure that all three events are well marketed and have a great turn-out.
  5. Create marketing materials for all events, including member sign-ups and community outreach.
  6. Email blast all new members recommending the join our Facebook, Blog, and Satira. Inform them or our mission and what we have done.
  7. Communicate with local press to build awareness of our mission and events.
  8. Develop and maintain the best quality photos of events and committee meetings to Women in Comedy Headquarters for social media.
  9. Attend weekly scheduled meetings with your committee.
  10. Review Bloggers material to ensure it aligns with our brand
  11. Facebook: become a moderator for our facebook page and help us increase awareness and engagement of women doing amazing things in the community
  12. Instagram: increase our followers and engagement on instagram.
  13. Twitter: increase our followers and engage in conversations to draw attention to our organization.
  14. Outreach/Research: help us identify organizations who are doing similar work to us so that we may reach out to them for collaborations.

  15. Calendar: help us find female written/directed shows and events by city and add them to our online calendars in each city. Help us connect and engage with women who want their work seen on this calendar.

Our volunteer base is building and expanding. We are excited to be in the launching phase of the organization and this will afford opportunities for dedicated volunteers to become volunteer department heads in the near future as the organization evolves and we identify the top areas of need in our community. For now, we are asking volunteer event coordinators to help us replicate and facilitate events in various cities. Our opportunities allow our volunteers to help remotely as well if they cannot physically be present.

STEP ONE: Please email us at SF@womenincomedy.org OR respond to this posting
STEP TWO: Fill out our volunteer form: http://goo.gl/forms/mCLvC6NXNe

opportunities.description:
First Graduate is building a pool of volunteers who are willing and able to interpret during our Parent/Student meetings. Volunteers would need to be fluent in English and either Cantonese, Mandarin, or Spanish, and should be comfortable presenting in front of a group of 30-60 families.

Opportunities are on-going during the year, but we usually have 4 large parent meetings/presentations every October, 2 every January, and smaller individual family meetings when necessary

Locations will vary, but all will be in San Francisco and transit-accessible.

opportunities.description:
Sign up your team and join Meals On Wheels of San Francisco (MOWSF) to support Low-income seniors by assembling fresh groceries from the SF Marin Food Bank into bags on delivery day: Wednesday mornings!

Why involve your team with our homebound senior community?

  • Share the commitment, responsibility and gratification of preparing bags for over 230 low-income seniors in need!
  • Pack up the bags, then load up the delivery volunteers' cars and send them off with a smile!
  • Assebly and production lines are a great way to bring a team together!
  • Perfect for teams of 5-20
  • Early morning shift from 7:00a-9:00a
  • Take a coffee break and tour the kitchen and facilities!

Seeking an experienced IT professional (3-5+ years' experience) to service the non profit and commercial accounts for IT services for Mac and PC repair and consulting. You would be running IT services and training future technicians in Mac and PC.

Passion for volunteer work is a must! You will be working alongside bright, dedicated professionals who enjoy devoting their time to a good cause.

RRRcomputer.org's mission is to reclaim computers from recycling to reuse for education for low income K-6 kids. We reduce computer waste by refurbishing the computers to put back into circulation for the kids to use for internet search for research, and doing their homework assignment at home. The computers that are going to recycling is still useful for their needs. We do our part in saving the planet and improve the education of children.

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: ENTERTAINMENT LEAD

The entertainment lead oversees all of the entertainment takes place during the Relay For Life event, which may include choosing the type of entertainment and when it occurs.

Individuals in this role are creative, organized, and know what it takes to have a good time. Additionally, individuals in this role are comfortable with and willing to cultivate relationships with various groups and organizations in the community that are willing to contribute to and participate in the excitement of the Relay For Life event.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:

  • Collaborate with ceremonies lead and activities lead regarding schedule of events and activities to plan and implement Relay For Life event activities

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!
opportunities.tags: activities, games, Entertainment, Emcee, shows, event production, event coordination, event management
opportunities.title: Love to plan & organize great entertainment for friends and family - RFL of San Francisco wants you!

opportunities.description:
WOMEN IN COMEDY

SEEKING VOLUNTEERS TO JOIN THE COMMITTEE OF THE BRAND NEW SF CHAPTER

WELCOME

Welcome and thank you for your interest in donating your time as a volunteer executive committee member of the SF chapter to further Women In Comedy. Your time is so valuable to us and we appreciate you!

MISSION STATEMENT

So, what are we here to do? It is very important to us that you understand our Mission Statement to understand what we are here to accomplish:

"We believe in educating, empowering, and connecting powerful, ambitious, hilarious, and talented women in the comedy industry with resources that foster their professional development and advancement. Through our online and real-life community, we promote the creation of personal relationships, business relationships, and mentoring relationships in order to advance and increase women's voices, presence, and pay scale in the comedy industry."

VOLUNTEER AREAS

Our areas of volunteer opportunity are ever-evolving which means our volunteers will always be engaged in new and exciting activities. Currently, we are seeking well-connected, organized, and reliable volunteers to help our brand new SF Chapter. As the chapter grows you will help grow its network and facilitate live events in tandem with our Chicago hub.

Role: Head of Volunteer Recruitment & Communications for SF Chapter

The Chapter Head of Volunteer Recruitment & Communications is a part-time volunteer position responsible to carry out our mission statement to empower, connect, and advocate for women and girls seeking paid careers in comedy. The Head of Volunteer Recruitment & Communications is the head coordinator and responsible for securing all volunteers and communications with volunteers and the committee for our 3 key events each year (put on in sister cities across the nation in Winter, Spring/Summer, Fall).

Duties may include but are not limited to:

  1. Spearhead and execute the volunteer recruitment of 3 successful events in tandem with headquarters utilizing all Women In Comedy documents, timelines, and assignments.

  2. Recruit, monitor, and review email based bloggers for WiC.

  3. Answer and respond to phone calls, emails, and more from headquarters, volunteers, venues etc.

  4. Attend weekly scheduled meetings with your committee.

Our volunteer base is building and expanding. We are excited to be in the launching phase of the organization and this will afford opportunities for dedicated volunteers to become volunteer department heads in the near future as the organization evolves and we identify the top areas of need in our community. For now, we are asking volunteer event coordinators to help us replicate and facilitate events in various cities. Our opportunities allow our volunteers to help remotely as well if they cannot physically be present. If you are interested in continued volunteering with us:
If you are interested in continued volunteering with us:

STEP ONE: Please email us at SF@womenincomedy.org OR respond to this posting
STEP TWO: Fill out our volunteer form: http://goo.gl/forms/mCLvC6NXNe

opportunities.description:
RRRcomputer.org's vision is "1 Child, 1 Computer" to become a reality. Our mission is to reclaim, refurbish, reuse computers from recycling to reuse for education for low income K-12 kids. We reduce computer waste by refurbishing the computers to put back into circulation for the kids to use for internet search for research, and doing their homework assignment at home. The computers that are going to recycling is still useful for their needs. We do our part in saving the planet and improve the education of children.

We are looking for a marketing professional to help guide our marketing effort. We want to persuade companies and corporations to rethinking their recycling process. They can satisfy both the Corporate Social Responsibility as well as Environmental effort by getting their tax deductible donation to RRRcomputer.org

Hue

opportunities.description:
If you are passionate about CSR and global philanthropy, help UniversalGiving build new and existing corporate client relationships through research, outreach, and analysis.

Full Description

UniversalGiving™, an award-winning global social-entrepreneurship nonprofit organization, is seeking a CSR Intern to join our exciting team. The Intern will be responsible for establishing new corporate relationships through outreach proposals, assisting with existing client services, building our contact pipeline throughout our network, researching and identifying key players and companies working in area of CSR, and analyzing competitors utilizing our competitive matrix. The Intern must have excellent communication skills; strong attention to detail, and a commitment to using and updating Salesforce, our relationship database. This internship is ideal for someone wishing to attain industry experience and explore key areas within corporate social responsibility and global philanthropy.

UniversalGiving™ internships offer exciting opportunities to those wishing to make a significant impact and contribution to our global communities. Join UniversalGiving and work closely with a dedicated international team, while gaining valuable skills and insight in a social-entrepreneurship nonprofit organization.

Testimonial
"Working with UniversalGiving has given me the chance to participate in critical aspects of business management and partnership facilitation, which are opportunities that would definitely be off-limits to "the intern" at most corporations. The friendly and ultra-supportive executive team here wants their interns to contribute to the main goals and aspirations of UniversalGiving in important ways and helps them to do so, which is what makes working here so rewarding and fun - so fun, in fact, that I will continue to be a part of their team even after leaving the San Francisco office!" --- Emily Stehr, UG Representative at Princeton University, Summer Intern

About UniversalGiving
 UniversalGiving™ is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model™ to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled on CBS and in FOX Business Network, and has also been featured in BusinessWeek Fast Company, CSRWire, WomenEntrepreneur, Oprah.com, NBC News, The Christian Science Monitor, The New York Times, The Financial Times, MarketWatch, CNNMoney.com, Change.org and See Change Magazine. UniversalGiving™ is the 2010 winner of the Opportunity Knocks' Best Nonprofit to Work for Award.

CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is also a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute. She has been chosen as a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR.

Duration: Minimum 15-20 hours per week, ideal candidate is available Tuesday through Friday 9am-5pm for the duration of the internship (3-4 mo internship). Ideal candidates are available to work in our downtown San Francisco office.

Qualifications:

  • Good writing and communication skills
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Experience in a collaborative/team based environment
  • Commitment to using and updating Salesforce, our Relationship Database
  • Strong critical thinking skills
  • Computer skills, Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Interest in nonprofit work, international issues, and philanthropy
  • Full support of the mission and vision of UniversalGiving™

Benefits:

  • Experience working at a unique global, social-entrepreneurship nonprofit
  • Collaboration within a positive team environment
  • Increased understanding of and alignment with global issues
  • Networking with other nonprofit professionals
  • Career mentoring with Pamela Hawley, Founder & CEO of UniversalGiving™
  • For students, class credit can be arranged according to school requirements

To Apply:

Email your resume, cover letter, and writing sample (2 pages max) to volunteers@universalgiving.org with "CSR Intern Intern/Volunteer" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please.

UniversalGiving™ is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations.

UniversalGiving’s vision is to "Create a World Where Giving and Volunteering Are a Natural Part of Everyday Life."™

For more information please visit:

  • UniversalGiving’s website
  • UniversalGiving’s Blog: PhilanthroPost
  • CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog: Living and Giving
  • Follow Us on Twitter: @ UniversalGiving and @ PamelaHawley
  • Like us on Facebook

opportunities.description:
Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade.

Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life.

With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency.

No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm.

Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
opportunities.tags: School, reading, children, tutoring, low-income, mentoring, literacy, teaching, youth, students, kids, STEM

opportunities.description:
The National MS Society, Northern California Chapter is looking for an energetic, responsible and organized individual to join the Development Team. The Big Day of Giving Internship is an exciting position, working independently, along with team assistance to create and execute a successful strategy for the participation by the Chapter in Sacramento’s local 24-hour day of giving campaign.

More than $6 million in funds were raised by numerous local nonprofit organizations during the 2016 Big Day of Giving. Last year, the Northern California Chapter of the MS Society brought in $3,000 and we hope to grow that exponentially with the help of a dedicated and highly-organized addition to the team.

This Big Day of Giving Internship will be unpaid and part-time, with much professional experience to be gained and eligibility for class credit.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop communications plan and timeline for promoting the Chapter’s participation in BigDoG
  • Proactively create and schedule most May 4 th social media posts in advance of event
  • Generate creative ideas for encouraging donor giving and sharing social media posts with personal networks
  • Produce materials for distribution and promotion
  • Work with marketing team to retrieve any assets or resources needed to build posts
  • Update GivingEdge profile online
  • Participate in all trainings and meetings required by Foundation to qualify for BigDoG
  • Create and coordinate Society Big Day of Giving events, if any
  • Create strong plan for day-of outreach
  • Attend Society gatherings, such as self-help group meetings, to promote
  • Write article for Chapter’s local newsletter
  • Contact Sacramento businesses that align with the Society’s mission to procure partnerships and matching funds

opportunities.description:
Northern California Music & Art Culture Center has been a 501c community based non-profit organization for 24 years. We are dedicated to supporting young musicians and artists who will continue to meet the cultural and educational needs of a diverse population. We envision to provide every child, regardless of income level, with the opportunity to develop a lifelong love for music and art through access to quality education in an environment that is comfortable to diverse populations.

We are currently seeking a Grant Writer/Fundraising volunteer to find more funding sources and work towards making our scholarship program more accessible to underprivileged children. Hours are flexible depending on volunteer's schedule.

If you are interested in utilizing your skills in generating funds to support underprivileged children in music and art education, please contact us with your resume.

Thank you.

opportunities.description:
Please submit your name at the below link:

Submit name here: https://educationfirst.ninjagig.com/jobs/volunteer-local-team/

Interested in helping low-income youth get a college degree? Would you like to give thousands of dollars to deserving students who aspire to improve their lives and community?


Join Education First and be a leader in your local community. For 20 years, Education First has been providing college scholarships to underserved communities and has awarded $700,000 to date. Visit www.educationfirst.org

We are specifically looking for volunteers in SEATTLE, PORTLAND, and San Francisco

Local Volunteer exceptions:
- Serve on local team and assist with regional activities of fundraising, interviewing applicants, and awarding scholarships
- Be a Regional Chair (optional) and lead one of the major activities described above for your city
- Stay in touch with our scholars while they attend college

- Run for a national board position and take an increasing level of responsibility

The best candidates are self-motivated, have a passion for the cause, graduated from college, and are familiar with Microsoft Office products.

These positions have a time commitment varying between 3 and 8 hours per month and averages around 4. Positions are designed so they can be held by those with other commitments.

For more information on volunteering check out:
http://www.educationfirst.org/become-a-volunteer.php

Please submit your name at the below link:

Submit name here: https://educationfirst.ninjagig.com/jobs/volunteer-local-team/
opportunities.tags: under-served youth, low income, Higher education, first generation college student, Board Member, Scholarships

opportunities.description:
Join our exciting coalition of volunteers - we will provide training and link you to a local site to assist low-income families and seniors in your community. We have over 250 sites throughout eight counties in the Bay Area (Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Napa, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, and Solano). Check out the top 10 reasons to become a tax preparer with EKS!

All of our tax preparers and screeners must be trained and certified by the IRS. Training class schedules vary by county and begin in December and/or January. On average, three to four days of classroom instruction is offered. For tax professionals or experienced volunteers, an online training and certification tool is available in November.

Site operation hours vary by site, but each volunteer is asked to commit to volunteer regularly (at least a 4 hour shift per week), beginning late January through April 15th.

opportunities.description:
If you answered yes to any of these questions, then Relay For Life of San Francisco event is looking for you!

This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: FUNDRAISING LEAD

The role of the fundraising lead is to grow the Relay For Life evet income through working with the Team Captains, team members, and the community by providing them information and resources needed to the raise funds to fuel the mission of the American Cancer Society.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

  • Work closely with team ambassadors to educate teams how to set fundraising goals, meet those goals, and educate on what tools are in place to assist them

  • Plan and implement fundraising workshops to ensure Team Captains and participants understand best practices for fundraising

  • Assist Event Leadership Team in educating community, teams, volunteers, and participants on fundraising activities

  • Educate Event Leadership Team & community on the American Cancer Society’s impact in the fight against cancer

  • Plan & implement strategies to aid in pre-event, day of event, post-event, online, and offline fundraising

  • Assist recognition lead and team ambassadors to ensure all fundraising volunteers are properly credited and recognized for their fundraising efforts

  • Assist sponsorship lead to ensure all event-level cash donors, team-level cash donors, and in-kind donors are properly credited and recognized for their sponsorship efforts

  • Ensure that Event Leadership Team includes and considers fundraising in their plans

  • Leverage all activities, events and entertainment as fundraising opportunities

  • Review fundraising benchmarks on a monthly or bi-monthly basis with event lead, fund the cure lead, and Relay For Life Staff Partner to ensure goals are being met

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!
opportunities.tags: Sales, fundraising, fundraiser, community outreach, networking
opportunities.title: Passionate about raising money to fight cancer - RFL of San Francisco is looking for you.

opportunities.description:
Help out with our Student Adult Leadership Program (S.A.L.T.) S.A.L.T. is a program designed to take kids out of Visitacion Valley and introduce them to new activities, ideas, and people. Volunteers MUST HAVE A CAR that can sit at least 5 including themself, and proof of insurance for that vehicle.

ALL VOLUNTEERS MUST CONTACT SARAH BEFORE VOLUNTEERING for proper paperwork and detailed information on outings
Sarah@rocksf.org

Take a look at all of the exciting opportunities on our schedule this session:

Jan 28- University of SF or San Jose State Tour
9:30AM to 4:30PM

Feb 11- AT&T park- Giants Fan Fest
10AM to 3PM

Feb 18- Letterman Digital Arts Center
10AM to 3PM

Feb 25- UC Santa Cruz Tour
9:30AM to 4:30PM

All Saturdays start at our R.O.C.K. office, include transporting kids to the activity, interacting with kids during and chaperoning, and then returning them to the R.O.C.K. office at the end of the activity. We are looking for volunteers that can help provide positive adult relationships for middle schoolers and high schoolers.


ALL VOLUNTEERS MUST CONTACT SARAH BEFORE VOLUNTEERING for proper paperwork and detailed information on outings
Sarah@rocksf.org

opportunities.description:
The purpose of Women United Clothing is two-fold. Our goal is to provide long-term solutions for women in severe poverty. We believe that providing training and job creation for women who are at high risk can not only serve as a solution for these women but also provide ethical/fair trade clothing for consumers who want to buy products that are free from sweatshop labor.

Our current work is a job creation project in Quito, Ecuador which provides rehabilitation and skill training for survivors of sex trafficking. We are working in collaboration with a local organization in Quito to start a tailor shop that can provide jobs for women coming out of their rehabilitation program.

We have a wonderful board of amazing women but are very aware of our gaps in expertise. We are currently looking for board members or committed volunteers who can provide:

Fundraising/Grant writing: experience fundraising for non-profits. Knowledgeable about strategies and is well connected in the affluent community with the ability to find and connect with large donors.

Sales/Marketing strategist: Experienced (5-10 years) in effective marketing tools, history of success and drive.

CFO: Financially wise and responsible, experienced in financial management and advising.

Legal Advice: Knowledge and experience of non-profit law and international trade.

Local outreach: Extroverted, driven and resourceful. Committed to community and well connected with organizations and neighborhoods in San Francisco.
opportunities.tags: fair trade, rehabilitation, Sex Trafficking, women's rights, ethical production

opportunities.description:
Become a Planning Committee Member

ACT-W conferences run on the energy of our volunteers who care about empowering women in technology. The ACT-W Bay Area Conference is an annual one-day action-packed event where talented women can build skills, grow their community, and accelerate their career path by connecting with companies that truly fit them best. The conference includes speaking sessions, hands-on workshops, one-on-one coaching sessions, and more.

As a committee member, you’ll be a vital part of the conference and help to create a welcoming and outstanding conference experience for about 300 participants from the Bay Area. The planning experience is a unique opportunity to participate in the conference activities. ACT-W Bay Area Planning Committee Members will be responsible for various conference duties such as sponsorship outreach, conference and speaker schedule development, event management, food and beverage planning, on-site logistics, and more.


What is expected of me?

As a Planning Committee Member, you’ll be expected to be available for the entire conference planning up until the conference on April 7th - 8th, 2017.


Who can volunteer?

  • Anyone 18 and over


Open Planning Committee Positions

(Examples below, but please note that positions may fluctuate and/or overlap due to event needs)


Workshop & Speaker Event Manager

  • Finds industry leaders in Tech-related workspace to volunteer time / expertise to teach during ACT-W Event

  • Workshop leaders must have prior experience teach classes / workshops

  • Workshop leaders must be approved by Leadership team (Kristin / Jenny)

  • Works with other Workshop team members to make sure we have a varitey of workshops set up

  • Makes sure workshop leaders are committed (signed contracts) and have materials needed to run workshop / know their audience

  • Helps workshop leaders get set up on the day of the event

  • Liaison between workshop leader / ChickTech


Catering Event Manager

  • Finds vendors to sponsor ChickTech for ACT-W Event: (Saturday, April 8th) (8:30AM - 6PM)

  • Needed: Breakfast foods / drinks, Snacks, Lunch food / drinks, evening happy hour drinks / cocktails)

  • Budget: $XX (TBD)

  • Owner of Everything: From logistics, to set up/ take down. Makes sure vendor has everything they need. Make sure tables are there for set up/take down. Make sure Ice, cups, utensils, napkins, trashbags, etc. are provided for smooth event

  • Works with Kristin to oversee venue set up


Sponsorship Conference Manager

  • Helps team find Sponsorships / Partners (Company Sponsors, Food Sponsors, materials, SWAG, etc.)

  • Helps on the day of the event with Sponsors set up / Makes sure they have everything they need / know where to go

  • Defines level of sponsorship for each sponsor / what they are given / what they give us

  • Clearly communicates role of ACT-W / makes sure Company sponsor is looking to hire or at least share best practices / workshops

  • Works with Catering team or Marketing team to sync on sponsorships

  • Goal is to find 15 Sponsors


Event Volunteer Manager

  • Gathers team of volunteers to manage on the day of the event

  • Managers team on the day of ACT-W Event

  • Has list of who they will be in chage of managing on the day of the event

  • Works closely with other Event Volunteer Manager

  • Creates Bay Area Shirts for entire ACT-W Team
opportunities.title: Call for Conference Planning Committee Members for the ACT-W conference

Make sure Ice, cups, utensils, napkins, trashbags, etc. are provided for smooth event Works with Kristin to oversee venue set up Sponsorship Conference Manager Helps team find Sponsorships / Partners (Company Sponsors, Food Sponsors, materials, SWAG, etc.) Helps on the day of the event with Sponsors set up / Makes sure they have everything they need / know where to go Defines level of sponsorship for each sponsor / what they are given / what they give us Clearly communicates role of ACT-W / makes sure Company sponsor is looking to hire or at least share best practices / workshops Works with Catering team or Marketing team to sync on sponsorships Goal is to find 15 Sponsors Event Volunteer Manager Gathers team of volunteers to manage on the day of the event Managers team on the day of ACT-W Event Has list of who they will be in chage of managing on the day of the event Works closely with other Event Volunteer Manager Creates Bay Area Shirts for entire ACT-W Team

opportunities.description:
Volunteer Expectations:

Rock Steady Boxing SF offers boxing-inspired fitness classes only to people with Parkinson’s disease. "PD" boxing classes are not appropriate for non-Parkinson’s persons who want to learn to box or intend to use the class time to work out for themselves. Volunteers are expected to assist RSB Coaches during class at all times. Classes are not designed to provide the volunteer a boxing workout, but for the volunteer to gain knowledge and experience assisting people with Parkinson’s disease.

Volunteers will be assigned to classes as needed. RSB has a maximum number of volunteers that can participate at the same time dependent upon the PD class level. Volunteers are expected to notify RSB when they are unable to participate during their assigned class. We ask that volunteers commit to helping with at least one class per month. Ongoing Volunteer Orientation classes available.

Rock Steady Boxing SF class times:

Sundays: 12 p.m. - 1:30 p.m. (This class is held at our 2345 Harrison location)

Mondays: 10:30 a.m. - 12 p.m. & 1:15 p.m. - 2:45 p.m.

Tuesdays: 8:15 a.m. - 9:45 a.m.

Wednesdays: 10:30 a.m. - 12 p.m. & 1:15 p.m. - 2:45 p.m.

Thursdays: 8:15 a.m. - 9:45 a.m.

Fridays: 9:15 a.m. - 10:45 a.m.

opportunities.description:
Volunteers are needed to lead fun, engaging activities for travelers both in the hostel and in the surrounding community. Examples include movie nights, game tournaments, walking tours, pub crawls and so much more! Share your interests with people from around the world.

Benefits of Volunteering with HI USA include:

-Earn free HI USA Membership and dorm overnights

-Meet other travel enthusiasts, make new friends!

-Opportunity to share and utilize your skills and talents

-Professional and personal growth

If interested, please complete the Become a Volunteer form and the Online Orientation here: https://www.hiusavolunteers.org/

opportunities.description:
* Do you love working with children?

* Are you considering a career in teaching, but lack classroom-type experiences?

* Have you been looking for a way to give back to the local community?

* Do you need a meaningful way to gain community service hours?

UP ON TOP invites you to come volunteer!!!

UP ON TOP is an academic, recreation, and arts-education program serving a diverse group of hard-working students in San Francisco's Western Addition and Tenderloin neighborhoods. Volunteers help support our students as tutors, readers, and homework helpers. We are always hoping to find energetic, dependable volunteers with a wide-range of interests, backgrounds and experiences to complement our current staff and volunteers.

Current opportunities are primarily in our Tenderloin program for 2nd-grade to 5th-grade students (although we could accept a limited number of new volunteers in our K-1st-grade Western Addition site).

We ask for a minimum commitment of once a week for 90-minutes, EVERY week until June 2017...ideally continuing through summer into next Fall.

For more information or to set up an appointment for an orientation please contact one of our most amazing volunteers Mimi Toyama at mimi@upontop.org or by office phone 415-912-9737.
