opportunities.description:
The Alliance Francaise of San Francisco is seeking a Development Assistant Volunteer to help support our team with outreach, membership development, fundraising and community engagement.


Your volunteering time can make the difference!


Duties:


  • Make phone calls to solicit items and donations from local businesses.
  • Contact former students and actual to fill a satisfaction survey
  • enter the data
  • Assist with outreach for donations
  • work on our online fundraising campaign to renovate the place
  • Research and input information into database.
  • Assist with large mailings, preparation of packets and other projects.
  • create templates for emails, letters,....

  • Requirements:
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team setting.
  • Experienced with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
  • Experienced with salesforces (preferrably the non profit starter pack).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Exceptional organizational skills with impeccable attention to detail.
  • Professional speaking style and demeanor.
  • Enthusiastic and positive attitude.
  • French speaking preferred

Hours/Time Commitment:

Commitment of 10 hours or more per week for a minimum of 3 months.

plus for 50h volunteering you can have french classes fro free.

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: Fund The Cure Lead

Lead role: The Fund the Cure Lead drives the fundraising and mission education of the American Cancer Society and Relay For Life within the community.

Individuals in this role are organized and dedicated to the strategic development and execution of educating the public about the mission, advocacy, and education efforts of the American Cancer Society that seeks to eradicate cancer and engage them in activities that promote the Society’s value proposition to save lives and help people stay well, get well, find cures, and fight back

.

SPECIFC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

* Assist People Lead and Experience Lead in recruiting Event Leadership Team members.

* Assist and mentor the Mission Lead, ACS CAN Lead, Registration Lead, Accounting Lead, Fundraising Lead, and Sponsorship Lead.

* Provide guidance and support in developing a strategic plan to educate the community on the mission and advocacy efforts of the American Cancer Society and Relay For Life.

* Partner with the Relay For Life Community Manager to create and execute development strategy to grow the mission and advocacy connection and quality of the event.

* Meet with Event Lead and Relay For Life Community Manager monthly or bi-monthly to benchmark goals and progress.

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!

opportunities.description:
Did you know that there's another trail system in San Francisco? The trails have been off the radar for some time. SF Urban Riders is proud to announce that we're working with the Laguna Honda Hospital and Rehabilitation center to restore trails and habitat on their property.

Join us for trail work the Second Saturday of the month. In case of heavy rain, we may reschedule.

Meeting location and parking map: https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=1F3kH6F7Opuzv7sZpl4HetrR31AY

We will post updates at https://www.facebook.com/events/388075054879654/

Snacks provided after!

opportunities.description: If you love animals, have pets, or wish you had a pet, this opportunity would be great for you! Rabbit Rescue has been working with homeless rabbits since 1995. We partner with PetCo stores to give rabbits visibility to the public, do adoptions, and educate people about having pet rabbits. We house severeral bunnies for adoption at the PetCo Potrero Hill location. We need help cleaning up after them and giving them hopping time and snuggle time. Hours are flexible. Volunteers must be at least 16 years of age or accompanied by a parent when volunteering. Come visit with a bunny!

opportunities.description:
After the election, many of us are wondering what's next and looking for the most effective ways to tackle one of world's toughest, yet resolvable, issues.

RESULTS (results.org) is a registered charity working to support the World Bank and United Nations in accomplishing their stated mission of ending extreme U.S. and global poverty by 2030 (defined as no person living on less than $1.90/day).

We do this by using our voices to change the world. Our 2000 volunteers in 28 countries meet with our Congressional Representatives and Senators at least once annually in the Capital and once in their local districts, and ask them to take specific positions on bills that will support the end of poverty through education, health and economic opportunity. We also write editorials and undertake community outreach to inform other citizens about how each of us can end poverty by 2030.

While you may be distressed to know that 17,000 children are dying every day due to hunger-related issues, I’m most excited that we’ve cut global poverty by half in recent decades, and saved millions of children’s lives. There is more still to be done, so I’d like to invite you to hear about it all at an upcoming event at the World Affairs Council in San Francisco.

RESULTS is a bipartisan organization that has been around for 36 years and worked within under a number of political climates, and achieved remarkable results!

RESULTS is a movement of regular, committed, everyday people (like you and me) who use our voices to help bring an END to POVERTY - in the US and globally. As volunteers, we are trained, supported, and inspired to speak with decision makers - members of Congress and the media - to encourage them to take action to expand access to health, education, and economic opportunity for all people. Over time, we learn to advocate powerfully for some of the most important issues of our time, and together, we realize the incredible power we have to change the world.

We have 110 chapters across the country, small groups grounded in our local communities that are a part of a global solidarity movement. We work in coordination to ensure that all people - especially children - can care for their most basic needs so that they can survive and thrive and reach their full potential.

We have chapters across the Bay Area and around the nation including San Francisco, Los Altos, San Ramon, Sausalito, Berkeley, Santa Cruz, etc.

At our monthly events we'll learn about some issues that RESULTS Bay Area activists can tackle, learn skills and strategy, and take a quick action to help promote effective education, health and economic opportunity leading to the end of extreme poverty by 2030 through Congressional and Senatorial support.

Come on out to learn how you can join local citizens to be a part of the solution to this globally and act locally in Arkansas! We would love to meet you!

We meet on the 2nd Saturday of every month from 11 am - 1 pm.

Call, text, or email Pankaj Agarwal:

(408)569-8711; resultsbayarea@pankaj.ca

Check out these short intro videos on who we are and what we do:

We Have a Vision (2 mins): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6QrCE01vV3w
Everyday Heroes (7 mins): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gEHkmOlXByk&app=desktop
opportunities.tags: support, Lobbying, lobby, hand up, hunger, training, senate, poverty, congress, Advocacy, ending hunger, world bank
opportunities.title: Extreme poverty and hunger ends by Year 2030 if we communicate effectively with Congress and Senate

parentOrg.name: RESULTS The Power To End Poverty

Leadership Position Open: Accounting Lead

Lead role: The Accounting Lead ensures there is an accurate record of how much money is raised to fuel the mission of the American Cancer Society.

Individuals in this role work behind the scenes to make sure all of the data is in order. They are comfortable doing timely online data entry, serving in a customer service role when it comes to accounting, handling money, and ensuring all policies and procedures are adhered to.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

* Collect and process cash and checks at Relay For Life event and other designated dates/venues.

* Manage online donation adjustments/questions as needed.

* Manage data capture for offline donations.

* Assist Registration Lead in advising teams and participants on donation collecting process and procedures.

* Work in close collaboration with the Relay For Life Community Manager, Event Lead, and Fund the Cure Lead to ensure correct training and steps are being followed.

* Meet monthly with the Fund the Cure Lead to go over benchmark goals and progress.

opportunities.description:
Support for Families is looking for dedicated and enthusiastic volunteers to help us at our Information & Resource Conference (IRC) on Saturday, March 11th. The IRC is a FREE conference for families of children with disabilities, the professionals who work with them, and members of the community. Over 800 people, including families, professionals, presenters, exhibitors and volunteers, attended this annual conference last year.

We are preparing for the annual Information and Resource Conference (IRC) and we would like to invite you to join us! The IRC is a free conference for families of children with special needs, professionals, and community advocates. We expect to see 700+ participants this year.

We have several ways to support the event!

Event Volunteers - We will be the volunteers that keep the event running smoothly. Whether it’s supporting the check-in process, the commissary, or in individual workshops. We will be the volunteers that ensure those families, professionals, and advocates are able to absorb as much as possible at this incredible event. We will have two shifts:
  • Morning: 8:30 am - 1:00 pm
  • Afternoon: 12:00 - 5:00 pm
  • Or: Superstar shift: All Day 8:30 am - 5:00 pm. You’ll be a star in my eyes J
  • Caregiving Volunteers - Caregiving Volunteer will facilitate a free play environment for kids whose parents are in attendance at the conference. You will be accompanied by staff at all times. This volunteer opportunity requires reference checks. The shifts times are the same as event volunteers.

If you are interested in either opportunity please fill out the Volunteer Application as well as the Volunteer Support Form

For questions, please contact: volunteer@supportforfamilies.org or 415-282-7494 ext.126

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: Fund The Cure Lead

Lead role: The Fund the Cure Lead drives the fundraising and mission education of the American Cancer Society and Relay For Life within the community.

Individuals in this role are organized and dedicated to the strategic development and execution of educating the public about the mission, advocacy, and education efforts of the American Cancer Society that seeks to eradicate cancer and engage them in activities that promote the Society’s value proposition to save lives and help people stay well, get well, find cures, and fight back

.

SPECIFC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

* Assist People Lead and Experience Lead in recruiting Event Leadership Team members.

* Assist and mentor the Mission Lead, ACS CAN Lead, Registration Lead, Accounting Lead, Fundraising Lead, and Sponsorship Lead.

* Provide guidance and support in developing a strategic plan to educate the community on the mission and advocacy efforts of the American Cancer Society and Relay For Life.

* Partner with the Relay For Life Community Manager to create and execute development strategy to grow the mission and advocacy connection and quality of the event.

* Meet with Event Lead and Relay For Life Community Manager monthly or bi-monthly to benchmark goals and progress.

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!

opportunities.title: Determined to find a cure for cancer?Relay For Life of San Francisco needs you!

opportunities.description:
The Jeremiah O'Brien is a World War II Liberty (cargo) ship built in 1943 and still steaming! The ship was part of the D-Day invasion of Normandy and sailed from San Francisco to France to participate in the 50th anniversary of D-Day. When not steaming, she is moored at Pier 45 in Fisherman's Wharf and is open to the public.

The ship is owned and operated by the National Liberty Ship Memorial, Inc., a non-profit corporation, and manned by about 175 volunteers. Operating personnel in the deck department and engine room are licensed by the US Coast Guard.

We are seeking a volunteer comptroller/treasurer to oversee accounting, budget, and financial reporting for the NSLM. Our small paid staff includes a part-time bookkeeper.

opportunities.description: Join our Talented Volunteers, the All Stars Project's award-winning volunteer program, in Youth Outreach! All Stars' volunteers are part of our nationwide team that has grown to over 2,000 people, and are the driving force in all of our programs. Our volunteers are passionate people whose tireless work and contributions have helped us to grow into our role as the new model for inner- city youth development. In this opportunity, volunteers work side by side with young people and All Stars Project adult volunteers. Offer youth in neighborhoods throughout San Francisco an opportunity to perform in our talent show, which is held in San Francisco and surrounding areas. The day includes: Training overview and role playing led by youth and adult volunteers; Outreach in the community; and Discussion of the days activities.

opportunities.description:
One American photographer. A fifty-year career. Two MILLION images. Help me with the next stage of my quest to preserve the collection.

Bob Mizer was one of the most prolific photographers of our time, and his work was nearly lost forever. Rescued from hot attics and damp storage lockers, this collection is an enormous visual treasure trove of both Americana and vintage male physique photography.

The Archive Team is responsible for following the archival workflows set by the Archive Manager. We are currently organizing and archiving the 35mm slide portion of this estate. While the slides are generally grouped by roll and model, the archiving process may include sorting before the slides are individually sleeved, photographed and bound.

Note: Photos in this collection may display male nudity or eroticism.

opportunities.description:
Volunteer Opportunity description

Office Assistant Volunteer

Tenderloin Neighborhood Development Corporation (TNDC) provides affordable housing and services for low-income people in the Tenderloin and throughout San Francisco, to promote equitable access to opportunity and resources. Please check us out at www.tndc.org.

Position Summary

The position is an office assistant volunteering under the supervision of the fund development department. This is a position for individuals with a strong organizational skills and a passion for equity, diversity and integrity. You will be assisting with mailing of our holiday cards.

This organization is volunteer-based and the position is uncompensated. There is a minimum commitment of 5 hours.

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: RECOGNITION LEAD

The recognition lead serves to ensure that all Team Captains, team members, volunteers, sponsors, and event participants know how much they are appreciated. The recognition lead works to recognize the accomplishments of all individuals regarding pre-relay events, day-of-event, and post-event using a variety of channels.

Individuals in this role are often creative and think outside-the-box to come up with new and exciting ways to recognize Relay For Life supporters throughout the community.

SPECIFIC ROLES INCLUDE:

  • Employ strategies to ensure that all volunteers, Team Captains, participants, sponsors, and Event Leadership Team feel appreciated

  • Plan & implement recognition materials and resources

  • Collaborate with fundraising lead and sponsorship lead to determine how recognition can help with rewarding fundraising and recruitment efforts

  • Ensure that community champions, team ambassadors, and survivors and caregivers lead include and consider recognition in their plans

  • Meet monthly or bi-monthly with the experience lead to discuss goals and progress.

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!

opportunities.description:
Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. The Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research.


As a Sr. Hybrid Mobile App developer you will manage and work with a team of developers, a Mobile App Dev Lead, and work in collaboration with Agile Project Manager, and UX experts to build a new Patient-centric Mobile App for Rare Genomics.


The primary responsibility of our Hybrid Mobile Developer is to develop utility and functionality using Xcode, Ionic, JQuery, PhoneGap.


As a Non profit organization, we are intending to design a Patient-centric mobile App based on open source platforms, or any free service mobile App development framework and AWS services.


Job Description:


  • Bachelor’s degree ( or equivalent ) in Computer Science or related scientific discipline

  • 2 Years of software development experience with an Object Oriented language

  • Proficiency in Xcode, INterface builder and Instruments.

  • Experience with hybrid tools\frameworks\API’s such as PhoneGap, Ionic, jQuery Mobile, Dojo Mobile, Cordova, etc.

  • Experience with 3rd party API’s integration, consuming web services (REST) and processing data (XML/JSON )

  • Extensive experience with HTML5, Javascript and CSS3, including Angular JS

  • Experience having deployed developed apps to Google Play and Apple App Store

  • Commitment to Rare Genomics values of attitude, commitment, and excellence

  • Familiarity with one or more beta app framework such as TestFlight, HockeyApp, Google Play Beta, AppBlade, Appaloosa, etc.


General Assembly candidates are welcome to Apply to this position.
opportunities.title: Hybrid Mobile App Sr. Developer
opportunities.plaintextDescription: Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. The Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. As a Sr. Hybrid Mobile App developer you will manage and work with a team of developers, a Mobile App Dev Lead, and work in collaboration with Agile Project Manager, and UX experts to build a new Patient-centric Mobile App for Rare Genomics. The primary responsibility of our Hybrid Mobile Developer is to develop utility and functionality using Xcode, Ionic, JQuery, PhoneGap. As a Non profit organization, we are intending to design a Patient-centric mobile App based on open source platforms, or any free service mobile App development framework and AWS services. Job Description: Bachelor’s degree ( or equivalent ) in Computer Science or related scientific discipline 2 Years of software development experience with an Object Oriented language Proficiency in Xcode, INterface builder and Instruments. Experience with hybrid tools\frameworks\API’s such as PhoneGap, Ionic, jQuery Mobile, Dojo Mobile, Cordova, etc. Experience with 3rd party API’s integration, consuming web services (REST) and processing data (XML/JSON ) Extensive experience with HTML5, Javascript and CSS3, including Angular JS Experience having deployed developed apps to Google Play and Apple App Store Commitment to Rare Genomics values of attitude, commitment, and excellence Familiarity with one or more beta app framework such as TestFlight, HockeyApp, Google Play Beta, AppBlade, Appaloosa, etc. General Assembly candidates are welcome to Apply to this position.

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: PRE-RELAY EVENTS LEAD

The pre-Relay events lead oversees all of the logistics and activities that take place prior to the Relay For Life event which may include choosing the type of activities and when they occur.

Individuals in this role are often creative, organized, and know what it takes to have a good time. They understand the importance of engaging participants, teams, survivors, and community members in year-round activities and events leading up to the community Relay For Life event.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:

  • Work with the event lead and experience lead to determine what the fundraising and recruitment goals are for pre-Relay events

  • Plan and implement pre-event activities and events including kickoffs, team meetings/rallies, fundraising workshops, Bank Nights, etc.

  • Assist mission lead and advocacy lead in educating Team Captains, volunteers, and participants about event entertainment, activities, and ceremonies

  • Assist survivors and caregivers lead to engage and educate survivors and caregivers

  • Assist recognition lead in ensuring all Team Captains

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!
opportunities.tags: activities, fundraising, coordination, rallies, event planning
opportunities.title: Like to organize events that raise awareness about cancer?  RFL of San Francisco wants you

opportunities.description:
Hello Artists!

NEXT Village SF is looking for someone to lead our monthly water color class for our seniors in 2017. Our long-time teacher, Vesta Kirby, recently passed away, and the people that come to this class look forward to seeing each other and painting something special each month. We’d like to be able to offer them the opportunity to connect and stay engaged through this class.

The class meets the first Friday of every month from 1-2:30 pm at the North Beach Library, 850 Columbus Avenue, San Francisco, CA. It is possible to change the meeting date, but we do need to work within the dates available at the library.

This is currently a volunteer position, but we can pay for your parking during class. If you know of someone you think might be interested, please feel free to pass this on to them.

Thank you!

opportunities.description:
950 elementary school students will converge on Ocean Beach to clean up trash and create a giant aerial art diplay to share their message of conservation with the world.

This program is funded by the California Coastal Commission’s Whale Tale license plate program. Now in its 24th year, this event is celebrated in 7 locations on the California Coast.

We need 35 volunteers to arrive at 8:30am for a volunteer orientation and to assist with: bus arrivals and parking, on-site registration, directing classes to their cleanup site, distributing supplies (trash bags, gloves, etc.), providing first aid (if you are certified), managing the water station and the snack station for volunteers, and most of all cheering on the kids while they wait for the helicopter to take their photo!

All students will be on their way back to school by 1pm. A post-event debrief for all volunteers and tacos will immediately follow the event. Tacos are generously being provided by Rubio’s Tacos.

This is a fantastic opportunity to reinforce the importance of clean oceans and watershed and ocean conservation - and you can be in the aerial art photo too! Each year is a blast! Come join in the fun!
opportunities.tags: cleanup, Oceans Day, Beach Cleanup
opportunities.title: Kids’ Ocean Day Adopt-a-Beach Program

opportunities.description:
The College Connect Intern (CCI) positions, require self-motivated individuals who are familiar with the Mission community, are bilingual in Spanish or Cantonese (preferable, but not required), and have a passion for working with youth. This is an unpaid volunteer position; and is a great opportunity for someone who wants to gain experience working with youth and their families in the Mission community.

Additionally, the CCI will gain knowledge of college access and success programming and building community with students and their families. CCI’s will work closely with the College Connect team to support the rising high school seniors, rising college freshmen, and current college students in our program.

The duration of the College Connect Intern and the weekly work schedule are negotiable, but we strongly prefer a commitment of 5 months or one school semester. Mission District residents, bilingual Spanish-English and people of color are strongly encouraged to apply.

Key Responsibilities & Primary Duties:

Direct Service (50%)

  • Assist high school seniors with college research to complete building their school list if they didn’t complete it over the summer.
  • Assist students to complete their personal statement if they didn’t complete it over the summer.
  • Assist Students to complete college applications, and FAFSA/ Dream Act applications if applicable.
  • Assist Program Coordinators during program meetings, workshops and events.
  • Support the College Connect team with youth one-on-one meetings/ support when needed.
  • Help students as needed with fly-in program logistics and college enrollment paperwork.

Administrative (50%)

  • Send reminder emails/calls/text messages to students about upcoming deadlines, meetings, activities, scholarships, etc.
  • Assist in communicating with and scheduling volunteers and interpreters when needed.
  • Assist in drafting blog and newsletter stories for the program.
  • Assist with program data tracking spreadsheets.
  • Help prepare for monthly meetings (buy food, photocopy materials, set up meeting space, etc).
  • Assist with other program related projects.

Required Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with college access challenges that are specific to first-generation college students.
  • Proven ability to work with people from diverse ethnic, socioeconomic, educational, religious, sexual orientation backgrounds.
  • Bilingual Spanish/English or Cantonese/ English strongly preferred.
  • Fingerprint and TB test clearance mandatory prior to internship.

To Apply: Send your resume and a cover letter to hr@missiongraduates.org, "ATTN: College Connect Intern."

Application Deadline: On or before Monday, January 9 th , 2017.

***Only applicants submitting both a resume and cover letter will be considered. Thank you!***

--

Mission Graduates is a community based nonprofit that works to increase the number of K-12 students in San Francisco's Mission and Excelsior Districts who are prepared for and complete a college education.

College Connect, a program of Mission Graduates, is a family ­based college access and success program for low-­income youth who will be first-­generation to attend college. This multi­year program provides structured, personalized college admissions support to students and their parents through high school graduation, as well as on­going academic advising, mentoring, and career coaching throughout college.
opportunities.tags: service, assistance, intern, administrative, education, college access, mentoring, college, volunteer, youth development

opportunities.description:
Position Summary

The Civic Center Soccer League Game Day Coordinator (Game Day Coordinator) supports America SCORES mission: America SCORES inspires urban youth to lead healthy lives, be engaged students, and have the confidence and character to make a difference in the world. The Game Day Coordinator's role is to help organize fun soccer games for kids in Civic Center Plaza.

Qualifications: Comfortable working with urban, multi-ethnic children. Strong verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Patient and able to multi-task. Background check and TB test may be required.

Interested? Please email Yuri Morales at ymorales@americascores.org

opportunities.description:
Do you want to help protect the ocean? Are you detailed oriented, love to plan events, and solicit donations?

Join the International Ocean Film Festival as the Gala Fundraiser Organizing Committee begins its planning and outreach efforts to raise funds for the education program of the upcoming 14th Annual IOFF.

We're looking for dynamic, enthusiastic, and passionate event planners to help us produce an incredible Gala Fundraiser. Scheduled for Thursday, March 2, 2017 at the historic Golden Gate Club in the Presidio, over 200 guests are expected as the party helps to launch the four-day film festival - the premiere ocean destination event for independent films.

Key volunteer roles include the following, but not limited to: soliciting live/silent auction items, vendor management, GreaterGiving online fundraising management, and assistance in program production management.

Help us plan for an unforgettable evening featuring film trailers, special guests, visiting filmmakers, and ocean themed entertainment as we raise awareness to protect the ocean through the power of independent films.

opportunities.description:
This opportunity is a for someone who is hands on, who wants more than a 1-day gig passing out water to runners and wants to find that cure for cancer. Relay For Life is planned, manned and produced by an Event Leadership Team of volunteers from San Francisco. We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: REGISTRATION LEAD

The registration lead oversees the registration of Relay For Life teams and participants, collection of participant data, tracking of incentive prizes, and assists Team Captains and participants with the online and offline registration process.

Individuals in this role work behind the scenes and with team ambassadors in a customer service role to ensure all of our registration data and fundraising data online is in order.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

  • Guide participants through Relay For Life registration process

  • Assist accounting lead to advise teams and participants in donation collecting processes and procedures

  • Manage data capture process for offline registrations and donations

  • Meet with experience lead to ensure that registration is a great experience for all participants

  • Meet monthly with the fund the cure lead to go over goals and progress

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

Sound like something you'd be great at?? Perhaps you'd only like a bite-size piece of this role?? Perhaps you & a family member or a friend interested in working on this together?? We would LOVE to chat & truly look forward to working with you to create a world without cancer!!!!

Individuals in this role will use survivor and caregiver recruitment resources and tools to be able to clearly communicate the benefits of getting involved with the American Cancer Society and the Relay For Life event. Individuals in this role will use survivor and caregiver recruitment resources and tools to be able to clearly communicate the benefits of getting involved with the American Cancer Society and the Relay For Life event.   • Collaborate with recognition lead to recognize and honor survivors and caregivers

The primary responsibility of the sponsorship lead is to secure financial, in-kind, and mission support from new and returning Relay For Life event sponsors and to ensure that all sponsors are appropriately recognized and thanked for their support.

Individuals in this role are comfortable representing the American Cancer Society and the Relay For Life program within the community and in the identification and recruitment of additional fundraising and sponsorship for the event.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

  • Develop relationships with new event-level cash sponsors, team-level cash sponsors, and in-kind sponsors

  • Develop and cultivate relationships with new event-level cash sponsors, team-level cash sponsors, and in-kind sponsors

  • Develop, cultivate, and maintain relationships with National Corporate Team Partner program members as appropriate.

  • Ensure Event Leadership Team includes and considers sponsor involvement in their plans

  • Track contact information, contribution details, and recognition for donors

  • Partner with recognition lead to determine and plan appropriate recognition for event sponsors

  • Review sponsorship benchmarks on a monthly or bi-monthly basis with fund the cure lead and Relay For Life Community Manager to ensure goals are being met.

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. opportunities.description:
Welcome to San Francisco Suicide Prevention. We're looking for empathic and reliable individuals to staff the late night portion of our crisis line. We have a large volunteer pool already serving our day shifts, but night time shifts tend to be more intense and require a greater degree of skill and training.

Overnight volunteers take calls every other week one night per week, from 11pm - 7am. Calls come in from all over the country but are concentrated in the Bay Area, and the time frame makes it so people are at their most isolated and afraid. Overnight volunteers attend our standard volunteer training, but mentor with overnight specific trainers.

San Francisco Suicide Prevention has been in operation since 1962, and was the first community based suicide hotline in the country. We operate with an emphasis of volunteers coming from all walks of life to provide peer-based support to those in crisis. There is a one-year or 200-hour minimum commitment.

All applicants must complete a volunteer application, available at the following URL:

http://www.sfsuicide.org/volunteers-and-interns/hotline-volunteers/

opportunities.description:
National Events Chair

We need an organized, action-oriented event coordinator who has extensive experience planning large events on small budgets, working with fearless volunteers. The National Event Chair oversees the strategy and planning of the Accelerators and Global Forum to bring together all facets of the Cleantech Open. This role needs someone dynamic who can galvanize a team of volunteers to coordinate venues, catering, programming, AV, and much more. This is a volunteer position with the potential for a stipend after a trial period.

Who we’re looking for:

Experience running large events, negotiating contracts, project managing timelines, and working with volunteers

Interest in the cleantech and green space to ensure sustainable events

Strong organization and self-discipline

Creative and inquisitive nature and passion to learn and apply something new every day

Ability to commit ~12 hours per week

What you’ll give:

In addition to helping run our National events program, you’ll:

  • Work with the National Training Chair to ensure the Accelerator content and programming flow smoothly with the event logistics
  • Work with the Volunteer Chairs to ensure manpower for events
  • Establish strong relationships with sponsor companies for their participation in events

What you’ll get:

Regular interaction with the brightest entrepreneurs, mentors, VCs and corporate professionals

Great exposure & education on building a successful enterprise from startup to mainstream player

A chance to roll up your sleeves & contribute in one of the most exciting business accelerators

A prestigious entry on your resume that reflects practical know-how in getting a cleantech business running successfully, including potential references, recommendations and expertise

opportunities.description:
Located on Union Square, this is an opportunity to work with a nonprofit that supports and teaches hand embroidery from around the world, from leisure to professional level.

Available positions include assisting with exhibits and stitch challenges, running the front desk, operating a small shop, assembling kits for classes, researching historic embroidery, as well as varied officework and needlework support.

No stitching experience required, however stitching on site is optional and encouraged.

opportunities.description:
The Jeremiah O'Brien is an fully functional, living musuem that sails. As a tribute to both those that served in World War II and specifically the Merchant Mariners who risked it all to deliver cargo to Normandy for the D Day invatsion.

It takes the voluteer staff of the Jeremiah countless ours of maintenance and volunteers knowledgeable in her operations to keep her sailing.

Deck department volunteer that hold a MMC licence or credential as a master, mate or seaman are always needed.

We invest in our volunteers through group training and 1-on-1 coaching from an American Cancer Society staff member. As the single largest fundraising event in the world, you get to be part of something pretty spectacular; it is truly a global movement. No experience necessary, however, a go-getter attitude is essential!

Leadership Position Open: Experience Lead

Lead role: Experience Leads develop the Relay For Life experience. They are the hospitality experts of the Event Leadership Team.

Individuals in this role build the fun, lead the strategic development, and execute of all Relay activities to ensure that participants have fun, are engaged, and enjoy their experience both at the event and through every interaction they have with Relay For Life. Individuals in this role possess strong leadership and mentoring skills and are comfortable representing the American Cancer Society and Relay For Life.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

* Work with the Event Lead and Relay For Life Community Manager to ensure that training of role and resources takes place.

* Assist the Event Lead and Relay For Life Community Manager in recruiting Event Leadership Team members.

* Assist and mentor the Ceremonies Lead, Relay Activities Lead, Entertainment Lead, Logistics Lead, Online and Social Communications Lead, Marketing Lead, Luminaria Lead, Recognition Lead, and Pre-Relay Events Lead.

* Partner with the Event Lead and Relay For Life Community Manager to provide guidance and support in developing the experience, entertainment, and activities of the event.

* Partner with the Relay For Life Community Manager to create and execute development strategy to grow the participation and quality of the event.

* Meet monthly or bi-monthly with the Relay For Life Community Manager and Event Lead to review goals and how the Relay For Life experience can assist with recruitment and fundraising.

So...at this point you may be wondering...WHAT IS RELAY FOR LIFE?

At Relay For Life events, communities across the globe come together to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. This community event is held on a local high school track or park and consists of inspiring ceremonies, activities and fun, and teams of friends, families, and co-workers coming together to finish the fight against cancer! The funds raised truly make a difference in the fight against cancer - just ask one of the nearly 14 million cancer survivors who will celebrate another birthday this year!

Each Relay For Life event is special to its community, but the movement's true power lies in the combined commitment of thousands of participants, volunteers, and supporters to help the American Cancer Society save lives from cancer.

Commitment requires regular check ins with your team lead and/or ACS staff member (in person, over the phone or via email) during Relay Season (January-August depending on event) and 2-3 hours a week of additional volunteer efforts. Schedule of work is up to you. For more information on Relay For Life and/or the American Cancer Society, please visit www.relayforlife.org/sanfranciscoca or contact Alexis Faughn at alexis.faughn@cancer.org

opportunities.description: Night Ministry Crisis Line Counselors (CLCs) offer compassionate, non-judgmental support to callers struggling with loneliness, depression, anxiety, worry, grief and other concerns. During hours when most social service organizations are closed, our night-time Crisis Counseling Line receives 18-20 calls per night, each of which can last anywhere from 5 to 50 minutes. Many of our callers face mental and physical health concerns, financial worries and social isolation, and they turn to us for counseling, conversation and referral services.

Leadership Position Open: YOUTH CHAMPION ROLE

Youth champions are strong advocates for building youth engagement in Relay For Life within their communities.

Individuals in this role are a voice and outward facing champion for the Relay event within the youth market in their community. They are outgoing and willing to speak and build relationships with schools and youth-based groups about the event with the goal of engaging youth in cancer awareness, education, and fundraising activities to grow Relay For Life participation and income. This can be in the form of new teams, committee members, srvivors, caregivers, or individuals, as well as Relay Recess and Relay Field Day Events.

SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE:

  • Develop relationships with and serve as the primary contact for decision makers at elementary schools, middle schools, high schools, school districts, sports groups, and other youth organizations

  • Recruit youth teams and individuals to participate in the Relay Event

  • Assist survivors and caregivers lead with youth survivor and caregiver recruitment

  • Work with the logistics lead to ensure risk management measures are in a place to protect youth participants

  • Work with the entertainment lead and activities lead to ensure there are games and activities geared toward all ages at the event

  • Work with local elementary and middle schools to host Relay Recess or Relay Field Day programs to support the community Relay For Life event

opportunities.description:
Visual Aide Graphic Designer ~ SF Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective (DLP/WC) is a grassroots-organized program deeply rooted in the community with strong support of key stakeholders. For over 20 years, the DLP/WC has been extremely successful at uniting, empowering, and organizing immigrant workers for dignified work and fair wages in San Francisco. Workers are organized in two collectives, one of men and one of women, to build collective power, develop skills, and operate a business.

Members of the collectives work together to eradicate the injustices that affect day laborers and domestic workers, fostering an organized environment where all workers can build their dignity, power and leadership. Members share a vision of a community where day laborers and domestic workers have the same opportunities and rights than any other worker. They accomplish this by offering each other opportunities to learn, work and participate in the movement of immigrant and domestic workers. The collectives are co-founders and leaders in the National Day Labor Organizing Network, National Domestic Workers Alliance, Progressive Workers Alliance, California Domestic Workers Coalition, Jobs with Justice, San Francisco Rising, among others.

In 2015, the DLP/WC started an exciting reorganization process with the objective of establishing a more sustainable and scalable model that enhances the impact of the program in the lives of immigrant workers.

The DLP/WC is looking for a graphic/visual designer to do a single project and work in tandem with our Visual Aide Organizer. This volunteer works in developing visual products that help Day Laborers understand resources available at the Day Labor Program. The ideal candidate is a creative individual with advanced skills in graphic design techniques, systems and tools.

Candidates must be available for 20-30 hours and project to begin as soon as possible.

Position Objective: This position supports the visual communication strategies of the program. This volunteer works in developing visual products that help deliver succinct and easy-to-access messages in a multi-cultural, multi-language environment.

Responsibility:

This position has the responsibility of developing visual products that help deliver succinct and easy-to-access messages in a multi-cultural, multi-language environment.

Expected Commitment:

  • 20-30 hours total and to begin as soon as available

Desired Skills:

  • Extremely creative and visual

  • Advanced skills in graphic design techniques, systems and tools

  • High level of professionalism and ability to meet deadlines on time

  • Commitment to social justice, specifically worker and immigrant rights

  • Compassionate and caring approach to supporting immigrant workers


ABOUT THE DLP/WC

Founded in 1991 and inspired by the socio-ecologic model, the DLP/WC unites, empowers and organizes immigrant workers to access dignified work and fair wages by building collective power, developing skills, and operating businesses. The DLP/WC power center offers on-demand labor for environmentally-conscious cleaning services, childcare, patient care, moving, hauling, painting, yard work, handyman repairs, installations and more.

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective is a program of Dolores Street Community Services, an equal-opportunity employer that seeks applicants of the greatest diversity possible, including women, people of color, lesbian/ gay/ bisexual/ transgender individuals, people living with HIV and persons with disabilities.

opportunities.description:
THE POSITION:

Meals On Wheels of San Francisco is seeking exceptional candidates to serve as Interns in the Volunteer department. Interns have an excellent opportunity to gain exposure to the breadth of non-profit work, and learn from an outstanding and experienced team. The MOWSF Volunteer department has the support of over 3,000 volunteers per year and many partnerships with corporations, organizations and schools who all in varied ways support our mission. This is a great opportunity to work with a well-respected and highly-developed volunteer program and develop skills in volunteer recruitment and management as well as the field of community engagement. We are seeking Interns that will help us expand our volunteer engagement efforts, while meeting even more of the needs of our homebound senior clients.

JOB SCHEDULE:

  • Summer 2016
  • Must be able to work 2-3 weekdays in our Bayview neighborhood office.
  • Minimum of 16 hours/week total, preferably 24 hours/week for a 3-4 month commitment
  • Available occasional evenings/weekends
  • hours can be flexible within normal business hours of 8:30a--4:30a
  • Up to full-time hours are available

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage all volunteer recruitment, updating online ads, website, and community contacts with current info. Work with both managers in volunteer department to ensure correct content. Report weekly on advertising updates and outreach activities.

  • Help with corporate, community group and school volunteer recruitment and coordination

  • Reply to all community group volunteering inquiries, communicating about various opportunities and scheduling events

  • Support group volunteer initiatives such as grocery bag assembly on Wednesdays and disaster kit deliveries, at times conducting the volunteer trainings at these events

  • Support general Volunteer Appreciation efforts, mailings

  • Some data entry required

  • Support with Special Events in June and late August

  • Other duties as requested by Director of Volunteers

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelors Degree or current/part-time students.
  • Experience/strength/interest in one or some of the following: Project Management, Marketing, PR, Editing, Communications, Non Profit Leadership/Management, Volunteerism, Corporate Relations, Development and Data Management
  • That you care about our mission statement
  • The ability to lift 35 lbs

BENEFITS:

  • Learning from and collaborating with one of the best non-profit Volunteer Departments in San Francisco

  • Networking and exposure to non-profit professional work

  • Being part of a positive, mission-oriented agency doing life-changing work on behalf of isolated seniors in the city.

  • College credit/fulfilling college requirements

  • If duties are fulfilled, a great letter of recommendation/references

SUPERVISION:

  • Reports to the Director of Volunteers

TO APPLY:

  • Submit resume and cover letter to dbelfield@mowsf.org To learn more about our agency, visit our website at: www.mowsf.org
  • Meals On Wheels of San Francisco is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, ethnic background, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin or disabilities.

opportunities.description:
San Francisco City Guides is offering an exciting opportunity to become a City Guide Volunteer. If you enjoy sharing, preserving, and perpetuating the history and folklore of San Francisco this is the perfect chance for you!


San Francisco City Guides is looking for individuals who have a love for the historical and cultural history of San Francisco. You will have opportunity to interact and meet walkers from all over the San Francisco Bay Area, the United States, and international visitors who love our tours. This is a wonderful chance to share your love of San Francisco with others. Volunteer Guides will be required to attend all eight training sessions on Saturdays 10am - 3:30pm starting on February 25 th. The application screening process is beginning soon, so apply ASAP!


Do you want to learn more?

Follow this link for more detailed City Guide requirements and to apply.
sfcityguides.org/becomeguide/apinfo.html


 Please also help us spread the word about this exciting opportunity!

About SF City Guides:

San Francisco City Guides is a non profit organization with more than 300 trained volunteers who lead FREE historical walking tours spanning 19 neighborhoods. We are sponsored by the San Francisco Public Library and are a San Francisco Parks Alliance partner. Tours are offered 365 days a year, rain or shine. Each month we offer approximately 30 different tours. City Guides provides this service to the public for free due to dedicated volunteers and committed sponsors. However, donations are welcomed! For more information contact: Libby Zazzera, libby@sfcityguides.org or by calling 415-557-4266.

Website: www.sfcityguides.org/index.html

Facebook: www.facebook.com/pages/San-Francisco-City-Guides-Free-Walking-Tours/114944540007

Trip Advisor: www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60713-d1830811-Reviews-San_Francisco_City_Guides-San_Francisco_California.html

opportunities.description:
Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade.

Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life.

With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency.

No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm.

Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.

opportunities.description:
The Justice & Diversity Center (JDC) connects volunteer attorneys with low-income clients who need legal help. Our monolingual clients need interpreters to communicate with attorneys in depositions and in completing paperwork. Most clients are at risk of being evicted, being sued for a debt, or have a family law matter. Utilizing your language skills provides critical help to clients so they can receive life-changing legal assistance.

Once you complete our free 1-hour interpreter training, we add you to our volunteer panel based on the language you speak. You will receive emails of available opportunities for your specific language and you choose the cases that match your interest and time availability.

We also need volunteer interpreters at our free walk-in legal clinics, held two Saturdays a month (one in downtown SF and one in the Bayview Hunter’s Point area).

Exciting opportunity to coordinate Chow Qigong Healing workshops and an established nonprofit international event: the 16th World Congress on Qigong/TCM in San Francisco in 2014. This event will correspond with institutions like Asian Heritage Street Celebration. The WCQTCM is the largest educational event of its kind.

Begin right away to put your great skills and imagination to work to make this our best year ever. Learn more about the World Congress: http://eastwestqi.com/worldcongress/15thworldcongress/

We are looking for positive individuals seeking to develop organizational skills in running events while gaining valuable insights into Qigong and healing.Please send us your resume.


This is a wonderful opportunity to work and learn from Dr. Effie Chow, Qigong Grandmaster, L.Ac., Dipl. Ac., Ph.D, and RN, who’s been in the integrative healing field for over 35 years and was appointed by Bill Clinton to the original 15 member White House Commission of Complementary and Alternative Medicine Policy.

Please check out our website www.eastwestqi.com or email: eastwestqi@aol.com

opportunities.description:
Northern California Music & Art Culture Center has been a 501c community based non-profit organization for 24 years. We are dedicated to supporting young musicians and artists who will continue to meet the cultural and educational needs of a diverse population. We envision to provide every child, regardless of income level, with the opportunity to develop a lifelong love for music and art through access to quality education in an environment that is comfortable to diverse populations.

We are currently seeking a Grant Writer/Fundraising volunteer to find more funding sources and work towards making our scholarship program more accessible to underprivileged children. Hours are flexible depending on volunteer's schedule.

If you are interested in utilizing your skills in generating funds to support underprivileged children in music and art education, please contact us with your resume.

Thank you.

opportunities.description:
Development Internship


UniversalGiving, an award-winning global nonprofit, is seeking a detailed and relationships oriented Development Intern. The Development Intern will play a strong operational role in the execution of our fundraising plan. You will help outreach to donors, maintain donor relationship information, help with fundraising mailers and events. If you are passionate about social change and enjoy working with an international team, come join UniversalGiving!


Full Description


UniversalGiving is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing vetted projects all over the world. Unique to UniversalGiving, 100% goes directly to the cause. UniversalGiving Corporate provides Strategy, Operations, and NGO Vetting to scale companies’ CSR programs in more than 120 countries; our Corporate Services allow us to become self-sustaining. UniversalGiving has been featured on the homepage ofBusinessWeek,Oprah.com,CBS, The Wall Street Journal, and The New York Times.


The Development Intern will focus primarily on researching high net-worth donor profiles, helping set up meetings with potential donors, and assisting with high-level mail-outs. The ideal candidate will have a strong commitment to customer service and dedication to cultivating and maintaining relationships with donors.Interns must be able to meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.


As a UniversalGiving intern, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a diverse, passionate team representing over 25 cultures. Our work environment is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, yet collaborative and fun, including monthly potlucks and team events. Come work with us to achieve our vision "To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life!


Responsibilities:


  • Perform research on high net-worth potential and existing donors, foundations and corporations

  • Specific research on potential funders using The Foundation Center as primary resource

  • Crafting customized communications with the Development team and the CEO

  • Assist with high-level mail-outs that are sent to high net worth individuals, foundations, corporations

  • Cultivate and maintain positive relationships by phone

  • Assist with fundraising campaigns

  • Salesforce Database entry

  • Other duties related to operations and administration

● Special development projects as needed on an on-going basis


Qualifications:


● Excellent written and verbal communication skills

● Meticulous attention to detail

● Ability to self-direct work and manage independent deadlines

  • Flexibility and adaptability to change

● Computer skills, Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

  • Commitment to using and updating Salesforce, our Relationship Database


Benefits:

  • Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship that has a global impact

  • Gain entry, exposure, and experience in the nonprofit industry

  • Increase your understanding of and alignment with global issues

  • Collaborate within a positive team atmosphere

  • Network with other for-profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment

  • Career mentoring with Pamela Hawley, Founder & CEO of UniversalGiving

  • For students, class credit can be arranged according to school requirements


Duration: Minimum 15-20 hours per week required for the duration of the internship, at least a minimum of 3 to 4 months. Ideal candidates are available to work out of our San Francisco office 3-4 days/week (Monday through Friday).


Testimonial

"I came into UniversalGiving as a shy recent graduate. I soon saw that this internship was like no other-- I worked on high-level projects, I was mentored by the CEO (unheard of!), and I bonded with the grooviest team I have ever come across. The nerves left, but the values and experiences will stay."

Germaine Lau, former Executive Assistant Intern


About UniversalGiving

UniversalGiving’s Mission: To connect people to quality giving and volunteer opportunities worldwide.

UniversalGiving’s Vision: "To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life"


UniversalGiving is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model(tm) to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause.


UniversalGiving Corporate consults with Fortune 500 companies on the Strategy, Operations and NGO Vetting for their international giving and volunteering programs all over the world. Some clients include Cisco, Symantec, Fluor, Sabre, Gap, BHP Billiton, RSF Social Finance, and inovia.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled onCBS and inFOX Business Network, and has also been featured inBusinessWeek,Fast Company,CSRWire,WomenEntrepreneur,Oprah.com,NBC News,The Christian Science Monitor,The New York Times,The Financial Times,MarketWatch,CNNMoney.com,Change.organdSee Change Magazine. UniversalGiving has been featured three times on Great Nonprofits’ annual Top Nonprofits lists and is a Webby Award Honoree.

CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of theJefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is a Finalistfor Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute. She is a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR.


To Apply:

Email your resume, cover letter, two writing samples (two pages max), and three professional references with contact information (phone and email) to volunteers@universalgiving.org with "Development Intern" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please.

UniversalGiving is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations.


For more information please visit:


● UniversalGiving’swebsite

  • Like us on Facebook

  • Follow Us on Twitter: @UniversalGiving and @PamelaHawley

  • Follow Us on Pinterest: @UniversalGiving

● CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog:Living and Giving

The Development Intern will play a strong operational role in the execution of our fundraising plan. You will help outreach to donors, maintain donor relationship information, help with fundraising mailers and events. If you are passionate about social change and enjoy working with an international team, come join UniversalGiving! Full Description UniversalGiving is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing vetted projects all over the world. Unique to UniversalGiving, 100% goes directly to the cause. UniversalGiving Corporate provides Strategy, Operations, and NGO Vetting to scale companies’ CSR programs in more than 120 countries; our Corporate Services allow us to become self-sustaining. UniversalGiving has been featured on the homepage of BusinessWeek , Oprah.com , CBS , The Wall Street Journal , and The New York Times . The Development Intern will focus primarily on researching high net-worth donor profiles, helping set up meetings with potential donors, and assisting with high-level mail-outs. The ideal candidate will have a strong commitment to customer service and dedication to cultivating and maintaining relationships with donors. Interns must be able to meet deadlines in a dynamic environment . As a UniversalGiving intern, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a diverse, passionate team representing over 25 cultures. Our work environment is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, yet collaborative and fun, including monthly potlucks and team events. Come work with us to achieve our vision \"To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life! Responsibilities: Perform research on high net-worth potential and existing donors, foundations and corporations Specific research on potential funders using The Foundation Center as primary resource Crafting customized communications with the Development team and the CEO Assist with high-level mail-outs that are sent to high net worth individuals, foundations, corporations Cultivate and maintain positive relationships by phone Assist with fundraising campaigns Salesforce Database entry Other duties related to operations and administration ● Special development projects as needed on an on-going basis Qualifications: ● Excellent written and verbal communication skills ● Meticulous attention to detail ● Ability to self-direct work and manage independent deadlines Flexibility and adaptability to change ● Computer skills, Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint Commitment to using and updating Salesforce, our Relationship Database Benefits: Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship that has a global impact Gain entry, exposure, and experience in the nonprofit industry Increase your understanding of and alignment with global issues Collaborate within a positive team atmosphere Network with other for-profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment Career mentoring with Pamela Hawley, Founder & CEO of UniversalGiving For students, class credit can be arranged according to school requirements Duration: Minimum 15-20 hours per week required for the duration of the internship, at least a minimum of 3 to 4 months. Ideal candidates are available to work out of our San Francisco office 3-4 days/week (Monday through Friday). Testimonial \"I came into UniversalGiving as a shy recent graduate. I soon saw that this internship was like no other-- I worked on high-level projects, I was mentored by the CEO (unheard of!), and I bonded with the grooviest team I have ever come across. The nerves left, but the values and experiences will stay.\" Germaine Lau, former Executive Assistant Intern About UniversalGiving UniversalGiving’s Mission : To connect people to quality giving and volunteer opportunities worldwide . UniversalGiving’s Vision : \"To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life\" UniversalGiving is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model(tm) to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause. UniversalGiving Corporate consults with Fortune 500 companies on the Strategy, Operations and NGO Vetting for their international giving and volunteering programs all over the world. Some clients include Cisco, Symantec, Fluor, Sabre, Gap, BHP Billiton, RSF Social Finance, and inovia. Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled on CBS and in FOX Business Network , and has also been featured in BusinessWeek , Fast Company , CSRWire , WomenEntrepreneur , Oprah.com , NBC News , The Christian Science Monitor , The New York Times , The Financial Times , MarketWatch , CNNMoney.com , Change.org and See Change Magazine . UniversalGiving has been featured three times on Great Nonprofits’ annual Top Nonprofits lists and is a Webby Award Honoree. CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award , and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute . She is a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR. To Apply: Email your resume, cover letter, two writing samples (two pages max), and three professional references with contact information (phone and email) to volunteers@universalgiving.org with \"Development Intern\" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please. UniversalGiving is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations. For more information please visit: ● UniversalGiving’s website Like us on Facebook Follow Us on Twitter: @ UniversalGiving and @ PamelaHawley Follow Us on Pinterest: @ UniversalGiving ● CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog: Living and Giving

Whether you're a grant writter, a storyteller, a marketing person, we need you!

Your actions will have a great impact!
