opportunities.description:
Are you looking for a regular volunteer opportunity where you can work directly with kids? We want you to tutor First Graduate middle school students!

Commitment: Once a week (Monday or Wednesday) from 3:30-4:30pm. August-December 2016.

Description:First Graduate is a college access program that helps students succeed in middle school, high school, and become the first in their families to graduate from college ready to pursue meaningful careers. On this path to college our students need help improving their academics and becoming the best students they can be. This is where you come in. We're looking for academic coaches to give students homework assistance and help them develop organization and study skills. You will work directly with small groups of First Graduate students (1-5) to help them succeed in school and develop skills beyond the classroom. This is a truly hands-on volunteer opportunity that makes a huge impact on our students' lives.

Academic coaches will be trained and supported by a First Graduate staff member throughout your time volunteering with us. It is our goal to ensure that you start working with students feeling confident, and always have a staff member present. All volunteers will be required to complete a background check before they start volunteering with First Graduate.

opportunities.description:
The Children’s Playroom provides therapeutic childcare for children while their parents meet with counselors, attend workshops, or utilize other services offered by the San Francisco Child Abuse Prevention Center (SFCAPC). Playroom staff and volunteers supervise playtime, read stories, and serve snacks to toddlers, preschoolers, and occasionally children up to age 13.

The Children’s Playroom is open Monday - Thursday, 10 AM - 2 PM and on select evenings and weekends. Volunteers serve 2-4 hours per week for a minimum of 6 months and must be at least 16 years of age to participate.

All volunteers are required to attend an initial 4-hour training session and one monthly volunteer meeting.

opportunities.description:
Asian Community Garden Intern (bayview)

Community Garden Liaison

The Florence Fang Asian Community Garden is one of SF's largest and most active community gardens. We have 30 to 40 gardeners who are mostly senior Chinese immigrants with very limited English proficiency. www.sfasiangarden.com

Our community garden is seeking a motivated individual who can work with our members, understand their needs, and assist in communicating those needs to our partner entities, including business entities, other community groups and governmental agencies. Transportation/parking stipend considered on as needed basis

GENERAL

* Four to 10 hours per week

* Three month internship, or school semester, flexible hours

* There is public transit getting to site, parking also available.

* www.sfasiangarden.com

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Interested in community organizing and/or community gardening

* Friendly, with excellent communication skills

* Experienced working with diverse groups, especially Asian American and African American communities

* Bilingual Cantonese helpful but not necessary

* Strong English speaking skills and writing skills

* Be on site some Saturday mornings (schedule flexible)

SAMPLE TASKS

* coordinating with Recology regarding pick up of rubbish/waste

* maintain communication with Bayview Police Station across the street

* invite local community groups to FFACG events

opportunities.description:
UniversalGiving(r) is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing vetted projects all over the world. Unique to UniversalGiving, 100% goes directly to the cause. UniversalGiving Corporate provides Strategy, Operations, and NGO Vetting to scale companies’ CSR programs in more than 120 countries; our Corporate Services allow us to become self-sustaining. UniversalGiving has been featured on the homepage of BusinessWeek, Oprah.com, CBS, The Wall Street Journal, and The New York Times.


The NGO Returnee will be responsible for playing a critical strategic and operational role in the outreach, research, and implementation of UniversalGiving’s 24-­‐stage Quality Model(tm). We are seeking an experienced professional who can work closely with our CEO to expand our partners. Our ideal candidate has significant experience in the non-­‐governmental organization sector and is ready to give back to a smart, efficient, and globally impactful nonprofit. Excellent communication skills, organizational skills and attention to detail are required.

UniversalGiving’s Returnship Program offer exciting opportunities to those wishing to make a significant impact and contribution to our global communities. Returnships are for experienced professionals returning to the workforce who desire to gain new skills, change professions, or simply yearning to give back.


 Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research on and outreach to new NGO partners based on NGO Strategy

  • Determine which NGOs fit UniversalGiving’s Quality Model prior to being published

  • Conduct research on NGOs by applying UniversalGiving’s Quality Model

  • Manage NGO profiles online, making sure they are up-­‐to-­‐date and accurate

  • Serve as the lead for NGO team and manage NGO interns


 Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree

  • Minimum of 5 years in non-­‐governmental organization sector

  • Excellent verbal and communication skills

  • Success in managing teams

  • Critical attention to detail

  • Flexibility and adaptability to change

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google applications (some training provided)

  • Prior experience with Salesforce is a plus


 Benefits:

  • Contribute your high-­‐level skills to UniversalGiving’s mission;

  • Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship nonprofit that has a global impact

  • Gain exposure, and experience in the nonprofit industry

  • Increase your understanding of global issues

  • Work directly with our CEO, Pamela Hawley

  • Collaborate with a positive and innovative team

  • Network with other for-­‐profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment


Duration: Minimum of 15-­‐20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. Ideal candidates are available to work in our San Francisco office 2-­‐3 days/week (Monday through Friday) with the possibility of some work completed remotely. As this is a leadership position, the majority of work should be done in-­‐office.

We value our interns and volunteers and take these positions very seriously. For this reason, we ask for a $200 fully refundable retainer to secure your position. This check pays for the your seat in our coworking space, professional training and management guidance that you will receive. Because our interns are such an integral part of UniversalGiving, we implemented this policy several years ago to ensure the accountability of all team members. We return your full deposit on the last day of your internship. Please do not hesitate to contact us with further questions!


 About UniversalGiving

UniversalGiving(r) is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model(tm)

to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause.

UniversalGiving Corporate consults with Fortune 500 companies on the Strategy, Operations and NGO Vetting for their international giving and volunteering programs all over the world. Some clients include Cisco, Symantec, Fluor, Sabre, Gap, BHP Billiton, RSF Social Finance, and inovia.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled on CBS and in FOX Business Network, and has also been featured in BusinessWeek, Fast Company, CSRWire, WomenEntrepreneur, Oprah.com, NBC News, The Christian Science Monitor, The New York Times, The Financial Times, MarketWatch, CNNMoney.com, Change.org and See Change Magazine. UniversalGiving has been featured three times on Great Nonprofits’ annual Top Nonprofits lists and is a Webby Award Honoree.

CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a Colburn S.Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute. She is a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR.

UniversalGiving’s Mission: To connect people to quality giving and volunteer opportunities worldwide.

UniversalGiving’s Vision: "To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life"(r)


Testimonial

"I came to UniversalGiving at a time when I was looking for a way to have more meaning with my work. After years in management consulting, finance, and then home raising two young children, I was ready to give back to the world in a different way. I began as a volunteer in their Returnship program and four years later, am leading Operations. UniversalGiving is a professional environment that has given me meaning, experience in new realms, and flexibility in my work schedule. I am so proud to be a part of this amazing team that is doing great things in the world."

Adriana Rabkin Former Senior Manager of Operations


To Apply:

Please email your resume, cover letter, a brief writing sample, and three professional references to volunteers@universalgiving.org with "NGO Returnship" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please.

UniversalGiving(r) is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations.


 Follow us on social media:
  • UniversalGiving’s website
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Follow Us on Twitter: @ UniversalGiving and @ PamelaHawley
  • Follow Us on Pinterest: @ UniversalGiving
  • CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog: Living and Giving

opportunities.plaintextDescription: UniversalGiving (r) is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing vetted projects all over the world. The NGO Returnee will be responsible for playing a critical strategic and operational role in the outreach, research, and implementation of UniversalGiving’s 24-­‐stage Quality Model(tm). We are seeking an experienced professional who can work closely with our CEO to expand our partners. Our ideal candidate has significant experience in the non-­‐governmental organization sector and is ready to give back to a smart, efficient, and globally impactful nonprofit. Excellent communication skills, organizational skills and attention to detail are required. UniversalGiving’s Returnship Program offer exciting opportunities to those wishing to make a significant impact and contribution to our global communities. Returnships are for experienced professionals returning to the workforce who desire to gain new skills, change professions, or simply yearning to give back. Responsibilities: Conduct research on and outreach to new NGO partners based on NGO Strategy Determine which NGOs fit UniversalGiving’s Quality Model prior to being published Conduct research on NGOs by applying UniversalGiving’s Quality Model Manage NGO profiles online, making sure they are up-­‐to-­‐date and accurate Serve as the lead for NGO team and manage NGO interns Qualifications : Bachelor’s degree Minimum of 5 years in non-­‐governmental organization sector Excellent verbal and communication skills Success in managing teams Critical attention to detail Flexibility and adaptability to change Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google applications (some training provided) Prior experience with Salesforce is a plus Benefits: Contribute your high-­‐level skills to UniversalGiving’s mission; Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship nonprofit that has a global impact Gain exposure, and experience in the nonprofit industry Increase your understanding of global issues Work directly with our CEO, Pamela Hawley Collaborate with a positive and innovative team Network with other for-­‐profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment Duration: Minimum of 15-­‐20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. opportunities.description:
Contribute to your community while using your professional expertise, and work with talented peers in a rewarding, non-profit environment! The Rare Genomics Institute (RG) is making a difference in the rare disease community. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research.

Job Description:


  • Assist with coordination, writing, & editing for patient/inquirer/expert communication vehicles both on and offline, including but not limited to emails, newsletters.

  • Assist with coordination of updates & improvements on RG's websites

  • Manage BeHeard's Social Media presence via Facebook, email marketing, Twitter, Blogs, etc. as directed by management

  • Develop & update general and program brochures, media kits, key messages, fact sheets, & other collateral material as needed.

  • Assist with coordination of media outreach & coverage with media releases, TV/radio interviews, feature stories, etc.

  • Other duties as assigned


Qualifications:

  • PhD or MA in the Sciences

  • BA or Higher degree in Writing, English, Public or Media relations, Communications, or related field or demonstrated min. of 2 yrs experience in one or more of these areas

  • Highly organized, attention to detail, results oriented

  • Exceptional verbal, written, & presentation skills

  • Strong editing skills

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office computer programs

  • Basic design/layout experience desired

  • Knowledge of electronic media such as Websites, e-Newsletters, Social Media,etc

opportunities.description:
Are you passionate about helping people make and sustain change in their lives? Do you have experience working with ethnic and culturally diverse populations and supporting people in reaching their life goals? If so, HealthRIGHT 360 Resource Center is actively recruiting volunteers to support various programs in housing, employment, and GED client services. At the Resource Center, we provide compassionate support and tools for formerly incarcerated individuals who are transitioning back into their communities and creating a stable living environment by building skills, accessing resources, and modeling professional behavior. Positions include:

  • GED Classroom Volunteer

  • Practice Interview Volunteer

  • Employment and Housing Support Volunteer

There is flexibility to combine opportunities based on your interest.

DESIRED SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS AND PERSONAL QUALITIES:

  • Previous experience working with people who may be homeless, recovering from drug addiction, formerly incarcerated, or from culturally and economically diverse backgrounds.

  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and listening skills.

  • Able to role model professional behavior and maintain professional boundaries.

  • Interest in working with diverse, disadvantaged populations including low literacy, learning disabilities, physical disabilities and impaired cognitive functioning.

  • Able to maintain client confidentiality.

Volunteers must commit to at least 3 hours per week for 3 to 4 months. The Resource Center is open to clients from 9 am to 4 pm Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, closed on Tuesdays, and 9am to 12pm on Friday.

Please note that all volunteers must have a TB test before beginning their volunteer service.

To apply, email Hailey, the Resource Center Coordinator, at hwright@healthright360.org and include your resume and letter of interest, noting the specific volunteer position(s) that you are interested in.

opportunities.description:
Best Friends Animal Society is looking for volunteers who are passionate about animals, fundraising and event planning to join the leadership planning committee in your community for the trademark Strut Your Mutt event series. Time will fly during this six to seven month experience. Volunteers will work on a committee with other passionate and talented individuals guided by Best Friends Animal Society event staff. Watch this fun video to check out what our events are like: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x3LD0fmRAvA&feature=youtu.be

∙ Local Planning Team - volunteers will serve as event coordinators, (approximately three per city) responsible for managing and planning the local event logistics and entertainment. This team will work together, with each person owning specific responsibilities that fall under logistics and entertainment (BF staff will help each team delegate the responsibilities based on the team members' experience and interests).

The San Francisco event is tentatively scheduled for Saturday, September 30th.

Click here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nHYCkwF_iIiHJ-w83l3-aLCLrfESkiINRDVDESL2Tr0/edit?usp=sharing to read the position description.


Interviews are currently being conducted. To be considered for a position, please submit your resume and letter of interest to bfvolcoord@bestfriends.org.

opportunities.description: As an FSD Intern, you will gain invaluable experience by working directly on grassroots initiatives in your area of interest--youth education & development, microfinance & microenterprise, health, gender equity, human rights, environmental sustainability, or appropriate technology. As you work with FSD’s in-country staff in one of ten international locations, you will receive on-site training and real-world skillbuilding. Our rigorous Intern Abroad program allows you to live with a host family and gain highly transferable skills in project design and management, participatory leadership, community assessments, budgeting/financial management, and cross-cultural communications. FSD alumni hold key posts at international agencies, consulting firms, and respected non-profits and foundations. Learn more about our programs at http://www.fsdinternational.org/trainingprograms. Please contact us with any questions via email at info@fsdinternational.org--or by phone at (415) 283-4873

opportunities.description:
You will work with high school students in small groups (4-7 students). Students bring questions they are confused about to their tutorial group. The tutor facilitates the group of students in a Socratic Tutorial. Students learn not only the answer to the problem, but critical thinking and problem solving steps. Training is provided in this highly effective method. Have the satisfaction of helping a teenager develop college and career readiness skills.

Upcoming training dates beginning in October and running through February. Begin working with students in Fall 2016 or Spring 2017. Make a difference in just 1-2 hours a week! All tutoring times are during the school day, between 8 AM and 4 PM.

opportunities.description:
Want to join the movement for housing justice? Join our crew of volunteers as a hotline counselor, and get trained on tenant's rights!

Our next training is:

Tuesday, Feb 7 & Wednesday Feb 8

5:30 - 8:30 pat our SF office

Click here to register or email sara@tenantstogether.org

Tenants Together, California's Statewide Organization for Renters' Rights (based in San Francisco), seeks volunteers to become tenants' rights counselors. Now more than ever, we need volunteer support to fight the federal and state policies that put many communities, especially, LGBTQIA, black and brown, and undocumented folks, at risk of wholesale displacement. And in communities with no rent control or eviction protections that are ruled by big real estate interests, like Stockton and Fresno, the Tenants Together Hotline is often the only service that offers information and support to low income renters. Counselors are key in the fight against gentrification and displacement.

We are in great need of Spanish speaking volunteers! We currently only have one Spanish speaking counselor, and in order to make the hotline accessible to monolingual folks and undocumented communities we need at least four. Please consider volunteering if you speak Spanish fluently.

Volunteers are expected to commit to at least 3 hours per week at the Tenants Together office located at 474 Valencia St, San Francisco. The Hotline operates Monday through Friday, 10:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M., and Thursdays 6:00-8:00 pm (we can also consider alternative time slots during the week, please contact Sara@tenantstogether.org to discuss).

The next scheduled two day training (both days required) is:

Tuesday, February 7th 5:30-8:30 pm

Wednesday, February 8th 5:30-8:30 pm


We aim to help build an anti-racist, feminist, multiracial, anti-oppressive tenant movement. This means we do not tolerate racism, homophobia, ableism, transphobia, islamophobia, classism, cis-sexism, or sexism. We also hope to continue working to make this event, and our office, as accessible as possible to everyone who is interested in being part of the fight for housing justice.

Accessibility: The building/ office is wheelchair accessible and is 2 city blocks from 16th and Mission BART . We will be taking regular breaks throughout the training. We have a gender inclusive bathroom. Unfortunately we are not currently a scent-free working space. If you have any accessibility concerns, requests or comments please email sara@tenantstogether.org
opportunities.tags: justice, Social Justice, renter, crisis support, anti-oppression, Housing Crisis, gentrification, counseling, tenant

Working directly with a local community organization in Salta, you will gain a valuable perspective on your profession in an international context as well as a working knowledge of global development issues. FSD's programs promote collaboration with communities to enhance the capacity of individuals and organizations to address local health, social, environmental, and economic issues in both the short and long term.

opportunities.description:
Volunteer Guides escort Volunteer Musicians from room to room as they play music for patients. Volunteer Guides knock on each hospital room door and ask patients if they feel like hearing music. They also introduce the musicians prior to their performances and guide them through the facility. Each guide is assigned to a specific healthcare facility.

The Volunteer Guide is the "eyes and ears" of MOC during the Bedside Performance Program as well as the liaison between the hospital and the Volunteer Musician. But most importantly, Volunteer Guides know the protocols, policies and expectations of the hospitals or healthcare facilities in which they volunteer and are responsible for making sure these guidelines are upheld during the program. Volunteer Guides are critical to the success of the program.

MOC’s orientation process includes an application, interview, handbook, orientation, quiz, background check and confidentiality agreement. Additionally, each healthcare facility typically requires its own orientation class, ID badge and sometimes immunizations, like TB tests and/or flu shots. Volunteer Guides may be asked to submit his or her shot record to the facility where they will be volunteering. In addition, MOC training involves shadowing an experienced guide at least twice.

MOC's requires all volunteers to commit to volunteering once a month for at least one year.

Please go to www.musiciansoncall.org/volunteer to apply!

opportunities.description:
Meals On Wheels of San Francisco is committed to the belief that all seniors have the right to live independently with dignity and respect in their own homes for as long as it is safely possible. It is our mission to provide isolated homebound seniors in San Francisco with nutritious meals, daily human contact, and supportive services to prevent their premature institutionalization. The food, companionship, safety checks, and other support we provide are vital services for seniors who want to continue living in their own homes but cannot shop or prepare meals for themselves. Our network of drivers, social workers, nutritionists, community partners, volunteers, donors, and advocates are a formidable force against senior neglect and malnutrition. We believe in delivering more than a meal - we are nourishing the whole person.

JOB SCHEDULE:

  • Must be able to work 1-2 weekdays in our Bayview neighborhood office.
  • Minimum of 8 hours/week total for a 2-4 month commitment
  • Hours can be flexiable within normal business hours of 8:30 AM to 4:00PM

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Data entry experience
  • Basic Internet and phone research
  • Ability to type 50 WPM with accuracy
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Experience with MS Word, Excel and google docs
  • Salesforce experience helpful but not required

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • The ability to lift boxed records weighting 25 pounds
  • Must pass a criminal background check

BENEFITS:

  • Learning from and collaborating with one of the best non-profit agencies in San Francisco Networking and exposure to non-profit professional work
  • Being part of a positive, mission-oriented agency doing life-changing work on behalf of isolated seniors in the city.
  • If duties are fulfilled, a great letter of recommendation/reference
  • This internship will give you experience and knowledge with SalesForce and Raiser’s Edge.

TO APPLY:

  • Submit resume to kstirling@mowsf.org
  • To learn more about our agency, visit our website at: www.mowsf.org

Meals On Wheels of San Francisco is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, ethnic background, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin or disabilities.

opportunities.description:
Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts was established by artists & community activists with a shared vision to promote, preserve and develop the cultural arts that reflect the living tradition and experiences of the Chicano, Central & South American, and Caribbean people, and to make arts accessible as an essential element to community development and well-being.
MCCLA is a multicultural, multidisciplinary arts organization committed to the collaborative artistic vision of the Latino art forms. MCCLA provides the community with an arena in which to develop new artistic skills, as well as support local and established artists that serve their community. MCCLA collaborates with other arts, social and humanitarian groups to provide the widest range of programming possible.

The Media & Events Intern will be responsible for promoting the organization's classes and events through various social media networks. The intern will research, plan and execute strategy with the goal of building community awareness and engagement around MCCLA.

This is an unpaid position but it is a great opportunity for students and recent graduates interested in gaining event promotion and media skills.

The ideal candidate will possess experience or the capacity to learn the following qualities/characteristics:

  • Resourcefulness and willingness to self‐start on social media posts and projects to promote events through social media content including, but not limited to: website, Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram

  • An understanding of and interest in historic and present elements of the Latino Arts as expressed in the US (dance, spoken word/poetry, film/video, music, theater)

  • Experience with event promotion

  • Familiarity with computers, internet research, MS Word, Excel

Candidates should send a resume, cover letter and three references to:

MCCLA Media & Events Intern
2868 Mission Street
SF, CA 94110


Any questions should be directed to Events Coordinator at 415.643.2796 or Volunteer Coordinator Art Campos 415-643-2776.
opportunities.title: Media & Events Internship

opportunities.description:
The Hospital Elder Life Program (HELP) is a unique program with goals to decrease confusion and loss of independence in older patients while in the hospital.

Volunteers are the core of the program and trained to provide bedside interventions in ambulating, orientating, hydrating and activities.

Our trainings are held annually in March and September. The training consists of 8 hours of classroom training, followed by 16 hours of precepted training at the bedside. We hold interviews for the orientation beginning 2 months before the training all the way up to the day before the training.

Must have good English speaking skills. Second language is a plus!

If you're interested please contact Shannon at cottersa@sutterhealth.org or 415.600.3916

opportunities.description:
Role and Responsibilities: The Office Assistant/Data Entry Volunteer supports Sunday Streets Directors by tracking current and prospective volunteers, supporters, community and program partners in Salesforce, assist with printing and organizing community outreach letters, and other data entry tasks as requested.

Benefits: Support Sunday Streets’ work while gaining valuable training and practice using Salesforce. Develop understanding of transportation issues and community engagement while growing your data management and organizational skills. Plus help increase Sunday Streets’ capacity.

Time Commitment: 3-5 hours per week, or 5-10 hours per month during office hours (M-F, 10-6pm). Schedule dependent on volunteer’s availability.

Qualifications:

  • Interest in healthy communities and social equity.
  • Must be 18 years of age.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) and Google Drive.
  • Ability to learn new skills and trouble shoot issues.
  • Previous experience and basic knowledge of Salesforce or other CRM strongly preferred.
  • Commit to three months (flexible) of volunteering.

Interested? Email joelle@livablecity.org including why you’d like to work with Sunday Streets, any relevant experience and qualifications, and your availability. This is an unpaid part-time volunteer position with an expectation of 5-10 hours per month.

opportunities.description:
The Bayview Hunter’s Point Home Delivered Groceries Program is a collaborative effort between Community Living Campaign, Having Pride UNITI, and San Francisco Food Bank. Our collaboration provides home delivered groceries to seniors (60 and older) and adults with disabilities in the 94124 who because of physical or mental disabilities cannot access the community food pantries that are currently available to individuals and families that qualify.

Currently, we are in immediate need of volunteer to help us bag the grocery items that are delivered in bulk from the San Francisco Food Bank. Volunteers are needed every Monday morning from 8 AM to 9:30 AM(excluding certain holidays). Volunteers must be able to lift about 20 - 25 lbs.

For more information, please contact Vernice Ross at veryniceross_havingprideUNITI@gmail.com.

opportunities.description:
Host Committee Organizer ~ SF Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective (DLP/WC) is a grassroots-organized program deeply rooted in the community with strong support of key stakeholders. For over 20 years, the DLP/WC has been extremely successful at uniting, empowering, and organizing immigrant workers for dignified work and fair wages in San Francisco. Workers are organized in two collectives, one of men and one of women, to build collective power, develop skills, and operate a shared business.

Members of the collectives work together to eradicate the injustices that affect day laborers and domestic workers, fostering an organized environment where all workers can build their dignity, power and leadership. Members share a vision of a community where day laborers and domestic workers have the same opportunities and rights than any other worker. They accomplish this by offering each other opportunities to learn, work and participate in the movement of immigrant and domestic workers. The collectives are co-founders and leaders in the National Day Labor Organizing Network, National Domestic Workers Alliance, Progressive Workers Alliance, California Domestic Workers Coalition, Jobs with Justice, San Francisco Rising, among others.

In 2015, the DLP/WC started an exciting reorganization process with the objective of establishing a more sustainable and scalable model that enhances the impact of the program in the lives of immigrant workers.

The DLP/WC is looking for an fundraising specialist to organize and lead our Host Committee for the upcoming 25th Anniversary Gala this October. This volunteer works 1-on-1 with the President of the Bars and Restaurant Owners Assoc of San Francisco. The ideal candidate considers one’s self an extrovert, loves social occasions, has experience in PR and/or Fundraising and is comfortable asking their individuals in their vast network for favors.

Position Objective: This position recruits members and leads fundraising efforts of the Host Committee for the upcoming 25th Anniversary Gala this October.

This position is part of a volunteer team that supports the fundraising initiatives of the Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective. It is directed to transforming the lives of low-wage immigrant workers at a personal level, in order to develop leaders who can promote the dignity of their work and transform the industries in which they work. This position has the following.

Responsibilities:

  • Recruit Host Committee members

  • Secure corporate and individual sponsors

  • Support the marketing and promotion of the event

  • Post event follow-up

Expected Commitment:

6 hours per month

8 hours during October 2016


Desired Skills:

  • Very sociable with a large professional network

  • Proven ability to build productive business relationships


ABOUT THE DLP/WC

Founded in 1991 and inspired by the socio-ecologic model, the DLP/WC unites, empowers and organizes immigrant workers to access dignified work and fair wages by building collective power, developing skills, and operating businesses. The DLP/WC power center offers on-demand labor for environmentally-conscious cleaning services, childcare, patient care, moving, hauling, painting, yard work, handyman repairs, installations and more.

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective is a program of Dolores Street Community Services, an equal-opportunity employer that seeks applicants of the greatest diversity possible, including women, people of color, lesbian/ gay/ bisexual/ transgender individuals, people living with HIV and persons with disabilities.
opportunities.title: 25th Anniversary Gala Host Committee Organizer

opportunities.description:
Friends of the San Francisco Public Library's $1 Steps Book Sales are held on Wednesdays on the Main Library Steps located on 100 Larkin Street.

Volunteers work in 2 shifts: 10:00 am - 1 pm, for Set Up and 1 pm - 4 pm, for Breakdown. We are always in need of volunteers so please sign up through our online application (https://www.shiftboard.com/friendssfpl/register.html) or email Manager of Volunteer Services, Brenda Salguero at brenda.salguero@friendssfpl.org.

This is a great volunteer opportunity for community groups, corporate volunteers, and court appointed service. Individuals, small groups, and large groups (up to 20) are welcome! Proceeds provide critical support for the San Francisco Public Library and related literacy and educational programs that benefit children, students, adults, and seniors.

opportunities.description:
Marketing Internship

UniversalGiving(r), an award-winning global nonprofit, is seeking a creative, enthusiastic Marketing Intern. The Marketing Intern will have a profound impact by helping us develop key partnerships to increase awareness of our work in over 120 countries. You will have the experience to work across many different areas such as Social Entrepreneurship, International Giving, and International Volunteering. If you are passionate about social change and enjoy working with a diverse and collaborative team, we would love to have you!


Full Description

UniversalGiving(r) is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing vetted projects all over the world. Unique to UniversalGiving, 100% goes directly to the cause. UniversalGiving Corporate provides Strategy, Operations, and NGO Vetting to scale companies’ CSR programs in more than 120 countries; our Corporate Services allow us to become self-sustaining. UniversalGiving has been featured on the homepage of BusinessWeek, Oprah.com, CBS, The Wall Street Journal, and The New York Times.


The Marketing Intern will be responsible for a variety of projects including marketing research, outreach, writing and relationship building. You will help prepare for major conferences and CEO events including setting up speaking engagements and organizing materials. You will gain practical, real-world experience through developing critical marketing partnerships and managing social media platforms.


As a UniversalGiving intern, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a diverse, passionate team representing over 25 cultures. Our work environment is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, but also collaborative and fun, including monthly potlucks and team events. Join us as we achieve our vision "To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life(r)!


Responsibilities:

  • Research and outreach to journalists, universities, and celebrities to develop critical marketing partnerships

  • Create unique, creative communications to be published on various marketing platforms

  • Prepare for CEO’s speaking engagements, conferences, and events

  • Manage social media platforms including Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest

  • Maintain important relationships/communications history in Salesforce Database

  • Provide administrative support as needed

  • With proven success and positive attitude, take on special projects and growing responsibility


Qualifications:

  • Excellent writing and editing skills

  • Demonstrated interest in the field of PR, communications, or marketing

  • Strong familiarity with social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest)

  • Ability to organize and manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines

  • Computer skills, Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

  • Commitment to using and updating Salesforce, our Relationship Database (experience with SalesForce a plus)


Benefits:

  • Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship that has a global impact

  • Gain entry, exposure, and experience in the nonprofit industry

  • Increase your understanding of and alignment with global issues

  • Collaborate with a positive and innovative team

  • Network with other for-profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment

  • Career mentoring with Pamela Hawley, Founder & CEO of UniversalGiving

  • For students, class credit can be arranged according to school requirements


Duration: Minimum 15-20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 to 4 months. Ideal candidates are available to work out of our San Francisco office 3-4 days/week (Monday through Friday).


Testimonial

"I came into UniversalGiving as a shy recent graduate. I soon saw that this internship was like no other-- I worked on high-level projects, I was mentored by the CEO (unheard of!), and I bonded with the grooviest team I have ever come across. The nerves left, but the values and experiences will stay."

Germaine Lau, former Executive Assistant Intern


About UniversalGiving

UniversalGiving’s Mission: To connect people to quality giving and volunteer opportunities worldwide.

UniversalGiving’s Vision: "To Create A World Where Giving and Volunteering Are A Natural Part of Everyday Life"(r)


UniversalGiving(r) is an award-winning website allowing people to donate and volunteer with top performing projects all over the world. Our projects are vetted through a proprietary Quality Model(tm) to ensure the most effective, trustworthy philanthropy possible. Unique to UniversalGiving, we take no cut on donations. 100% of your donation goes directly to the cause.

UniversalGiving Corporate consults with Fortune 500 companies on the Strategy, Operations and NGO Vetting for their international giving and volunteering programs all over the world. Some clients include Cisco, Symantec, Fluor, Sabre, Gap, BHP Billiton, RSF Social Finance, and inovia.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, UniversalGiving has been profiled on CBS and in FOX Business Network, and has also been featured in BusinessWeek, Fast Company, CSRWire, WomenEntrepreneur, Oprah.com, NBC News, The Christian Science Monitor, The New York Times, The Financial Times, MarketWatch, CNNMoney.com, Change.organd See Change Magazine. UniversalGiving has been featured three times on Great Nonprofits’ annual Top Nonprofits lists and is a Webby Award Honoree.

CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute. She is a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR.


To Apply:

Email your resume, cover letter, two writing samples (two pages max), and three professional references with contact information (phone and email) to volunteers@universalgiving.org with "Marketing Intern" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please.


UniversalGiving(r) is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations.


Follow us on social media:


● UniversalGiving’s website

  • Like us on Facebook

  • Follow Us on Twitter: @ UniversalGiving and @ PamelaHawley

  • Follow Us on Pinterest: @ UniversalGiving

● CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog: Living and Giving

UniversalGiving has been featured three times on Great Nonprofits’ annual Top Nonprofits lists and is a Webby Award Honoree. CEO Pamela Hawley is a winner of the Jefferson Award (the Nobel Prize in Community Service) and was selected as one of 50 leaders to the White House's Next Generation Leadership and Social Innovation event. She is a Finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award , and a Colburn S. Wilbur Leadership Fellow at the Global Ethics Institute . She is a Fast Company Expert Blogger on CSR. To Apply: Email your resume, cover letter, two writing samples (two pages max), and three professional references with contact information (phone and email) to volunteers@universalgiving.org with \"Marketing Intern\" in the subject line. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. No phone calls please. UniversalGiving (r) is committed to understanding and representing the diverse populations it serves worldwide. Members of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, races, ethnicities, nationalities, physical abilities or disabilities, religions or beliefs, and cultures are welcome as employees and volunteers in our organization. We believe that a diverse team will best serve our diverse populations. Follow us on social media: ● UniversalGiving’s website Like us on Facebook Follow Us on Twitter: @ UniversalGiving and @ PamelaHawley Follow Us on Pinterest: @ UniversalGiving ● CEO Pamela Hawley’s Blog: Living and Giving

opportunities.description:
Community Living Campaign-SF Connected is looking for volunteers to positively impact the lives of elderly San Franciscans. Many elders are interested in using technology to stay mentally limber and to become more connected to family, friends, and community. Do you have an hour each week to help seniors learn how to do different activities on the computer?

As a volunteer at the center’s computer lab, you will:

  • Teach elders computer basics (ex. touchscreen, mouse & keyboard, how to use a search engine, how to set up an email account or guide through fun brain fitness online activities.
  • Utilize accessibility features to help elder see/hear computer (training provided)
  • Record notes about participants' progress.
  • Submit an online report (class time, how many elders, how many hours).
  • Offer encouragement and helpful suggestions to help seniors succeed.
  • Offer appropriate new challenges as participants advance (We have lessons/guidelines available).

Adult Day Services centers serve frail elders. Tutoring may include working with seniors with independent skills to seniors who need ongoing repitition of instructions or engaging in online brain fitness activities.

Submit your interest for application. Once application is returned, a phone interview will be scheduled regarding matches with local centers, onsite orientation and then volunteer schedule will be set.

Preferred Time Commitment: minimum of two months with 1.5 hour a week - but flexibility in scheduling is available. Only Weekday and daytime hours are available with time choices between 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

Qualifications:

  • Basic computer literacy
  • Good people skills
  • Patience
  • With a myriad of walkers, wheelchairs, canes, hearing and vision disabilities; utilize safe and creative ways to access the computer comfortably. (We will demonstrate!)
  • Recent TB test (Can be done after attending orientation and before starting volunteer schedule).
  • Minimum age: 15 years

Bilingual skills are welcomed especially in Chinese, Spanish and Russian.

opportunities.description:
JOB SUMMARY

Our mission at the National MS Society is a collective of passionate individuals who want to do something about MS now - to move toward a world free of multiple sclerosis. MS stops people from moving. ... We are moving politicians and legislation to champion the needs of people with MS through activism, advocacy and influence. Key Chapter fundraising events held throughout the year include Bike MS, Walk MS, and DuskBuster.

Under the Development Department, the Graphic Design Intern will gain professional experience in production and development of collateral and promotional materials as they learn about corporate brand guidelines and build a portfolio. This internship will support a wide range of initiatives throughout the Chapter, so the applicant must be an upbeat self-starter, organized and enjoy a fast-paced work environment.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage design projects from concept development to final approval
  • Update event marketing and promotional materials (posters, trading cards, ads, etc.)
  • Create supplemental event marketing materials (postcards, t-shirts, jerseys, buttons, etc.)
  • Support design needs for year-end Chapter projects (annual report, brochure, etc.)
  • Design unique graphics for use in print, web and email
  • Other design and production projects as needed

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proficient with Adobe CS products (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)*
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office (especially Word, Outlook and Excel)
  • Ability to work well independently, incorporate suggestions and meet deadlines
  • Desire to approach challenges strategically and creatively
  • Understanding and usage of social media and the Internet
  • Strong writing skills and attention to detail
  • Skilled at collaborating cross-functionally

BENEFITS

  • Gain professional experience managing projects and balancing multiple priorities
  • Experience working within a nationally recognized brand framework
  • Work within a high-functioning and inspiring workplace atmosphere
  • Learn and contribute in a local non-profit environment with a national reach

TRAINING & EVALUATION

  • Northern California Volunteer Orientation
  • Online training courses (as relevant to internship)
  • Individual training with supervisor for special projects
    • Ongoing evaluation / feedback provided throughout internship

COMMITMENT

  • Six month minimum - longer preferred
    • 10-15 hours/week, flexible scheduling based on school load

APPLICATION PROCESS

Submit the following to Harmeet.bath@nmss.org

  • Resume and cover letter
    • Two or three samples of design work

opportunities.description: Help change and save lives and the world with Qigong and Traditional Chinese Medicine! Need a creative volunteer with SMM and SEM expertise to help with promoting our organization and our exciting calendar of educational and clinical programs for veterans, children and all people. Great opportunity to also learn to heal with Medical Qigong and create a valuable position for yourself within our organization. We are seeking volunteers who love interacting and communicating with people and are excited about developing, organizing, and promoting programs that have a positive impact on the community. An exciting non-profit, East West Academy of Healing Arts (EWAHA), for the last 39 years has been dedicated to training, clinical treatment, and the dissemination of information on Qigong and Complementary Alternative Medicine (CAM). Combining the best of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) and Western Medicine is the core of our philosophy and practice. Please send us your interest along with a full resume and date and times available to eastwestqi@aol.com There is an opportunity for an ongoing paid job. Visit us at www.eastwestqi.com and like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/eastwestqi to learn more about our organization!

opportunities.description:
Reach & Rise is a national YMCA program designed to build a better future for youth by helping them reach their full potential through the support of caring adults.

Reach & Rise group mentoring supports youth ages 8 to 15 who often reside in communities challenged by poverty, community violence, educational disparities and various other social issues. As a group mentor, you can build a supportive, consistent relationship with a group of young people. You will help to improve each mentee’s self-esteem, decision-making skills, school performance and interpersonal relationships.

Our site based group mentoring model pairs 2 volunteer mentors with 6 youth mentees. Volunteers provide group based mentoring services and create safe, healthy and meaningful relationships with youth. Group mentors will engage youth by utilizing therapeutically based interventions developed by Reach and Rise.


We hope to launch our very first Group mentor training the last week of April 2016! Our first mentor groups will be hosted in YMCA falicities.

MENTOR REQUIREMENTS

Mentors must

  • be at least 21years old

  • complete the 16+ hour training

  • Commit to 16 week mentoring session during the fall and spring, or 8 weeks over the summer.

  • pass fingerprint security screening

  • co-facilitate 2 hour mentoring group

  • Check-in weekly with program director

  • Monthly phone check-in with assigned mentees

opportunities.description:
Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. Rare Genomics Institute is a non-profit organization that helps families in need of genome research.

The IT Department is responsible for supporting and maintaining the IT systems, infrastructure and for providing technical support to users across the institute.

The post holder will provide effective data governance assistance across all aspects of the business.

Responsibilities:

The position will involve the following areas of responsibility:

  • Establish of a data governance framework, policies, and standards to comply with privacy, confidentiality, and information

  • Devise, develop, and maintain documentation related to Data Governance and data sharing processes and partnerships

  • Work with teams across the institute to ensure data is collected, accurate, stored, released, and reported in a manner consistent with the mission and needs of the organization

  • Act as point of collaboration between business and IT to ensure data quality and integrity


Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of data governance models and data management practices

  • Experience of designing and building a Data Governance strategy from the ground up

opportunities.description:
Tool Library Lead ~ SF Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective (DLP/WC) is a grassroots-organized program deeply rooted in the community with strong support of key stakeholders. For over 20 years, the DLP/WC has been extremely successful at uniting, empowering, and organizing immigrant workers for dignified work and fair wages in San Francisco. Workers are organized in two collectives, one of men and one of women, to build collective power, develop skills, and operate a shared business.

Members of the collectives work together to eradicate the injustices that affect day laborers and domestic workers, fostering an organized environment where all workers can build their dignity, power and leadership. Members share a vision of a community where day laborers and domestic workers have the same opportunities and rights than any other worker. They accomplish this by offering each other opportunities to learn, work and participate in the movement of immigrant and domestic workers. The collectives are co-founders and leaders in the National Day Labor Organizing Network, National Domestic Workers Alliance, Progressive Workers Alliance, California Domestic Workers Coalition, Jobs with Justice, San Francisco Rising, among others.

In 2015, the DLP/WC started an exciting reorganization process with the objective of establishing a more sustainable and scalable model that enhances the impact of the program in the lives of immigrant workers.

The DLP/WC is looking for a Tool Library Lead who will direct other volunteers to organize and launch this project. The ideal candidate has detailed knowledge of identifying a wide array of tool, the ability to recommend popular tools that should be added to the library as well as coach their Assistants on how to identify, implement and manage the library systems.

Position Objective: This position leads the organization of the tool library from conception through to completion.

This position is part of a volunteer team that supports the Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective. It is directed to transforming the lives of low-wage immigrant workers at a personal level, in order to develop leaders who can promote the dignity of their work and transform the industries in which they work.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify current inventory and recommend any gaps in popular items

  • identify, implement and advise how to manage the library systems

  • Specify staff and volunteer requirements and activities

Expected Commitment:

15 hrs total, to start as soon as available. Estimated duration is 1-2 months.

Desired Skills:

  • Excellent time management and communication skills

  • Ability to manage multiple projects independently

  • Previous experience using a wide variety of tools

  • Interest and/or experience in designing systems to organize objects and/or processes

ABOUT THE DLP/WC

Founded in 1991 and inspired by the socio-ecologic model, the DLP/WC unites, empowers and organizes immigrant workers to access dignified work and fair wages by building collective power, developing skills, and operating businesses. The DLP/WC power center offers on-demand labor for environmentally-conscious cleaning services, childcare, patient care, moving, hauling, painting, yard work, handyman repairs, installations and more.

The San Francisco Day Labor Program and Women’s Collective is a program of Dolores Street Community Services, an equal-opportunity employer that seeks applicants of the greatest diversity possible, including women, people of color, lesbian/ gay/ bisexual/ transgender individuals, people living with HIV and persons with disabilities.

opportunities.description:
Help enhance rare native plant habitat and create important wildlife corridors in the Presidio of San Francisco. Activities include invasive plant removal during the summer season and planting during the winter season. Come learn about local plants and animals and be a habitat hero!

Volunteer programs take place on Wednesdays and Saturdays,
9 am-noon and Sundays, 10 am-1 pm.

Visit our website to register and learn more about this program: http://www.parksconservancy.org/get-involved/volunteer/drop-in-programs/presidio-park-stewards.html

Volunteers must complete the Volunteer Agreement Form and volunteers under the age of 18 must have the parent/guardian approval section signed.

Wear clothes that can get dirty. Long pants and closed-toe shoes are required. Bring layers for changing weather and rain gear if necessary. Bring a personal water bottle and sunscreen.

Visit our Volunteer Homepage for more details about individual, group, family-friendly, or long-term volunteer opportunities: www.parksconservancy.org/volunteer

The Golden Gate National Parks Volunteer Program is a cooperative parkwide effort of the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy, the National Park Service, and the Presidio Trust.
opportunities.tags: service, habitat restoration, Parks, volunteer
opportunities.title: Presidio Park Stewards (Golden Gate National Parks)
opportunities.plaintextDescription: Help enhance rare native plant habitat and create important wildlife corridors in the Presidio of San Francisco. Activities include invasive plant removal during the summer season and planting during the winter season. Come learn about local plants and animals and be a habitat hero! Volunteer programs take place on Wednesdays and Saturdays, 9 am-noon and Sundays, 10 am-1 pm. Visit our website to register and learn more about this program: http://www.parksconservancy.org/get-involved/volunteer/drop-in-programs/presidio-park-stewards.html Volunteers must complete the Volunteer Agreement Form and volunteers under the age of 18 must have the parent/guardian approval section signed. Wear clothes that can get dirty. Long pants and closed-toe shoes are required. Bring layers for changing weather and rain gear if necessary. Bring a personal water bottle and sunscreen. Visit our Volunteer Homepage for more details about individual, group, family-friendly, or long-term volunteer opportunities: www.parksconservancy.org/volunteer The Golden Gate National Parks Volunteer Program is a cooperative parkwide effort of the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy, the National Park Service , and the Presidio Trust .

opportunities.description:
Must be able to commit to 3 - 6 months and able to participate in activities. Responsibilities include basic admin, room set up and disassemble for workshops, food bank, and fitness classes; home health care experience desired. A great opportunity for someone interested in pursuing a career in senior wellness, active adult wellness and education. Activities include but are not limited to - bingo, computer class, cooking class, food bank, speakers, field trips, etc.

Languages preferred - English, Spanish, and/or Tagalog.

Skills Desired: Medical/Health,Education/Training,Crafts,Public Speaking/Meeting Facilitation,Project Management

Requires Physical Ability (for example, lift up to 50 lbs.)

Matching Interests: Women's Issues, Veterans & Military Families, Poverty, Hunger, Homeless & Housing, Seniors, Education & Literacy, People with Disabilities, Immigrants & Refugees, Computers & Technology, Community, Health & Wellness, Arts & Culture

opportunities.description:
Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. The Rare Genomics Institute (RG) is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. The Rare Disease Task Force addresses inquiries from both patients and caretakers regarding rare diseases.


Position Responsibilities:

  • Respond promptly to patients’ inquiries

  • Perform literature and clinical trial searches

  • Effectively communicate the scientific literature in plain language

  • Write formal reports on the result of your research.

  • Connect patients to researchers in the field.

  • Follow up with patients regularly


Qualifications:

  • MD, PhD or doctoral candidate

  • Comfortable with navigating through PubMed and clinicaltrials.gov

  • Excellent writing skills
